Wara runs a cookery business at home; she sells rice and pure water. She has been running this business since 2008. She works at the business ten hours per day and six days per week. Wara says that the main challenge to her business is sometimes if the food is not finished, she will run at a loss.

Wara has requested a loan in order to buy more cooking items like rice, palm oil and cooking seasoning. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and renovate her house. 

In the future, she plans to open a big restaurant. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more cooking items like rice, palm oil and cooking seasoning.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a trained driver. He also owns a tailoring business, and this has been going on for the last ten years. He has one employee in the business, and he is a driver with a security company in Mombasa. 

Julius lives in Mombasa, and he is 35 years of age, married and blessed with two children. The business is doing great, despite the challenge of the pricing of products and inflation rates. He knew about Milango through friends, and he seeks a loan to buy uniform materials. 

The income raised from the business will improve his living standards and pay school fees for his children. He has a vision of opening a wholesale business in the next five years.

loans.use: to buy uniform material.

loans.name: Rimaz 1 Group

texts.en:
Nour El Huda is the featured borrower of Rimaz 1 group. She got together with the other group members to apply for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua because they have always been neighbors and friends.

Nour El Huda is a 29-year-old married mother of two children. She is a Syrian citizen living and working in Lebanon since she got married. She has been working selling clothes at her house for five years. Her work is improving, but she needs additional external support. That's why she is applying for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with a new clothes collection.

She is the first from the left wearing green. As for the other group members, Samira is the first from the right, and Ibtisam is the one wearing yellow.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with a new clothes collection.

loans.name: Imad

texts.en:
Imad is an 18-year-old single man who has been providing Internet services to his villagers since four years ago. He was only fourteen years old when he started his own business, to help his parents in their living. He is the sole breadwinner in his family, and is responsible for the living of two persons in his family.

Imad is applying for a Youth Loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, to update his Internet network in order to keep his customers pleased and satisfied. He also provides hookahs for his customers as an additional income, in addition to a pool table, which diversifies the business for the customers’ needs and requests.

Imad hopes to expand his business more and more in the future to attract more customers and increase his income.

loans.use: to update his Internet network, in order to keep his customers pleased and satisfied.

loans.name: Alfrida B.

texts.en:
Alfrida B. is 46 years old and lives in the West Point area, which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is a high school dropout, and she is married with four children between the ages of 13 and 30; only two live at home and are attending school.

Alfrida has been selling used clothes for the past four years, and she is a very successful businesswoman. One thing she enjoys about her business is that it helps her generate more profit to send her children to school.

She’s requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business; she plans to send her children to the university in the near future. She thanks BRAC for their help.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Davaasuren

texts.en: Davaasuren, 31 years old, lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family used to live in a rental apartment. She has been running a pay toilet business at a bus station for five years. Her husband renders taxi service to local people for a living. Using her previous loan, she purchased a new automobile for her husband as the old one had become obsolete. This time she is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to purchase building and insulation materials such as bricks, cement, planks, fiberglass and foam in order to repair and insulate her recently purchased old house. After renovation, she and her family can live in a comfortable and warmer place without worrying about incoming winter. The renovated house will enable the family to burn less coal for heating and release fewer pollutants into the air, contributing to the efforts against air pollution.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials

loans.name: Gulmaya

texts.en:
Gulmaya lives in the Absheron region with her family. She is 36 years old and has a child. She is looking after the child alone. 

Gulmaya started a café business seven months ago. Now she needs a loan of 1,800 AZN to buy tables and chairs for the café. 

In the future, she wants to use the profit to pay for her child's education, and also wants to repair her cafe. This will be more profitable for her business. 

She is thankful to Komak and Kiva for supporting her.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs for her café.

loans.name: San Ignacio  De Colón  (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
En  el sector conocido como Los Ángeles en la parroquia Colon  de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días las 11 socias y 1 socio del Banco Comunal San Ignacio De Colon. Las mismas que se dedican a diversas actividades tales como la agricultura, al comercio en general, la prestación de  servicios entre otras cosas. Ellas hace tiempo atrás decidieron unirse y formar este grupo de crédito el cual les ha ayudado mucho en sus negocios y su vida familiar.

Una de las socias de este grupo es  la señora Laura, tiene 40 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 12 y de 10 años que  estudian en colegio y  escuela. El marido es subcontratista en reparaciones de tuberías de agua.

Doña Laura es una mujer muy emprendedora que le gusta ganar su propios ingresos y con estos ayudar a su esposo a solventar los gastos del hogar y en especial los gastos de estudios de sus hijos, ella tiene un negocio muy variado en un local en su casa, allí  vende medicinas, productos de bazar y papelería, además de esto ella es artesana, realiza arreglos en carros alegóricos en diversidad de detalles y formas, hace trajes típicos hechos en material reciclable.  Esto le deja muy buenos ingresos ya que tiene muchos contratos  de instituciones o personas particulares que saben del buen trabajo que realiza, ella lleva con sus actividades más de 9 años y le encanta lo que hace. 

Este crédito es para comprar útiles escolares que es lo que más necesita actualmente para surtir su negocio. Esta desde el inicio  en  el Banco Comunal y le gusta por los créditos ya que estos le ayudan en su negocio. 

Sus sueños son mejorar cada día y darles lo mejor a sus hijos.

La foto pequeña es de una socia que no pudo estar presente cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The 11 female members and one male member of the San Ignacio De Colon communal bank meet in the area known as Los Ángeles in the Colon parish of the city of Portoviejo every 15 days.  They work at different business activities like farming, general commerce, and providing services, among other things.  Some time ago they decided to unite and form this communal bank, which has helped a lot in their businesses and family life.

Laura, age 40, is one of the members of this group.  She is in a common-law marriage, and she has two children, ages 12 and 10.  The children attend primary and secondary school.  Her husband is a subcontractor, and he works repairing water pipes. 

Laura is an very enterprising woman who likes to earn her own income with which she helps her husband pay the household expenses, especially the children’s educational expenses.  She has a very diverse business in her house.  She sells medicine, household products, and stationery items.  She is also an artisan.  She makes arrangements in different designs and shapes to decorate floats.  She makes typical clothing from recyclable material.  This leaves her with good earnings because she has a lot of contracts with institutions or private people who know about the good work that she does.  She has been involved with her business activities for over nine years.  She loves what she does.

This loan it to buy school supplies, which is what she currently needs the most now in order to stock her business.  She has been in the communal bank since it started.  She likes it because of the loans.  These help her in her business.

Her dreams are to improve every day and to give her children the best.

The small photo is of a member who was not able to be present when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy school supplies.

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
Mariatu is 40 years old and married with two children, ages 6 years and 12 years. She runs a fish business in Tombo, in the western rural area of Sierra Leone. She started this business to get her daily living. 

She's been in this business since 2000 and sells fish within her community. She says that at present, she is facing insufficient capital to run her business.

Mariatu requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more fish for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and take good care of her family. 

In the future, she would like to become an agent of Fishing Company. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for resale.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience is a 30-year-old business woman from Liberia. She and her fiancée are living together; they both have two children, aged 8 and 10. Her two children are currently attending school and live at home.  She had completed fifth grade before starting her business. She describes herself as a working woman.

She lives and works in St. Paul. St. Paul is home to the oldest market in Liberia and is known for its fish, due to its location by the sea. St. Paul is a suburb located just outside Monrovia, past the Freeport. It is one of the poorer areas, and you will often find its residents living in sub-standard housing. 

Patience has a cook shop (restaurant) which has been selling rice and soup for the past three years now. She works ten hours at her business. Her greatest challenge in business is that sometimes customers complain about the high price of food. 

She intends to use the loan to buy more food ingredients, such as dried bush-meat, fish, pepper, onions, Vita (juice drink), salt, etc. She started her business by selling for her mother. She likes her business because she makes more profit. She hopes to one day own a house.  

Thank you for supporting the borrowers at BRAC Liberia!

loans.use: to buy more food ingredients, such as dried bush-meat, fish, pepper, onions, Vita, salt, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chicks for his poultry business.

loans.name: Mamusu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! 

This is 40-year-old Mamusu from Tombo, in the western rural area in Freetown. She is married and blessed with eight children between the ages of 10 months and 22 years.  

Mamusu runs a cookery business at home; she sells cooked food at her house. She has been running this business since after the war. She works at the business throughout the week, from morning to night. Mamusu says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation and insufficient finances to expand her business.

Mamusu has requested a loan in order to buy more cooking items like rice, palm oil and cooking seasoning. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. 

In the future, she plans to change her business to a gari (cassava flakes) and palm oil seller. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more cooking items like rice, palm oil and cooking seasoning.

loans.name: Hamlet

texts.en:
Hamlet and his family live in Vanadzor City in the Lori region of Armenia. He lives with his wife, two children and retired mother in their private house. 

Hamlet runs his fruit and vegetable trading business from a rented stall in their city. Several loans from Nor Horizon, and one already from Kiva, have helped him to enlarge his business and increase his family income as well.

Hamlet is asking for a loan of 650,000 Armenian drams to buy a lot of fruits and vegetables for his stall. He sells tomatoes, cucumbers, beans, potatoes, greens, cabbage and fruit, such as peaches, plums, pears and apples. His stall is very rich in assortment, clean and nice. All of his customers are satisfied, both with the quality of service and prices.

loans.use: to buy a lot of fruit and vegetables to diversify the assortment he offers at his stall

loans.name: Khodor

texts.en:
Khodor is a 29-year-old single man, who has been working in furniture-making since six years ago. Khodor is the sole breadwinner for six members of his family. That's why he has to work harder to develop his business to make sure it will produce a very good income to cover his family's needs.

Khodor is applying for a Youth Loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, to buy the necessary requested sponges and threads. These will surely develop his business and improve his living because he will buy them at a very encouraging price.

Khodor hopes to keep on developing and expanding his business in the future, to make sure that his customers and family members are served properly.

loans.use: to buy the necessary requested sponges and threads.

loans.name: Fortaleza Group

texts.es:
Fortaleza es un grupo de la Ciudad de Encarnación, estan trabajando todas juntas hace ya 19 ciclos, son mujeres muy trabajadoras que estan dando todo de si para poder aprender aprender y por medio de esos conocimientos mejorar sus emprendimientos. Ellas estan haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza para poder conocer la situación de cada una de ellas y conforme a ello ir  trabajando.
Una de las integrantes de este grupo es la Sra. Gladys, quien tiene una despensa bien surtida donde vende y surte a sus clientes con los productos de primera necesidad. Ella es muy sacrificada, ya que día a día empieza a trabajar desde muy tempranas horas, hasta muy tarde en la noche. Solicita de esta crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de bebidas, lácteos, verduras y demás comestibles para seguir con sus ventas.
texts.en:
Fortaleza is a group in the City of Encarnación. They have been working together for 19 cycles. They are very hardworking women who are giving everything of themselves in order to be able to learn and through that knowledge improve their undertakings. They are doing the survey of poverty elimination in order to be able to know the situation of every one of them and in that way continue working. 

One of the members of this group is Gladys, who has a well-stocked grocery store where she provides her customers with high-necessity products. She is very selfless, and day after day she starts to work at very early hours, until very late at night. She is requesting this loan to be able to invest it in the purchase of sodas, milk products, vegetables and other food products in order to continue with her sales.

loans.use: to purchase sodas, milk products, vegetables, and other food products.

loans.name: Osvaldo

texts.es:
El Sr. Osvaldo es una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora, siempre se ha esforzado por salir adelante e ir mejorando su calidad de vida y la de su familia. Comenta que se dedica a la fotografía desde el año 2007, cubre todo tipo de eventos y gracias al excelente trabajo que hace se ha hecho conocido.
Su meta es poder seguir creciendo, ampliar su pequeño local e ir mejorando el servicio para sus clientes. Hoy solicita de este crédito para poder comprar una buena filmadora para poder mejorar sus servicios, agradece por esta oportunidad que esta recibiendo.
texts.en:
Osvaldo is a hardworking and determined person.  He has always worked hard to get ahead and is improving his quality of life and that of his family.  He says that he has worked in photography since the year 2007.  He covers all kinds of events and thanks to the excellent work that he does he has made himself well-known.

His goal is to be able to continue growing, to expand his small business premises and to improve the service to his customers.  Today he is requesting this loan to be able to buy a good video camera in order to be able to improve his services.  He is grateful for this opportunity that he is receiving.

loans.use: to buy a video camera.

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
Meet 35-year-old Mariatu from Tombo, in the western rural area of Sierra Leone, near Freetown. She is married with two children between the ages of four and six years old.  

She started her waxed cotton (oilskin) business after her wedding. She began her business because she was trained in business and needed to generate income to support the home. She works 10 hours a day, seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is a lack of capital.

Mariatu requires a loan to buy more waxed cotton for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will enable her to increase her business and improve her standard of living. 

In the future, Mariatu plans to expand her business even more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more waxed cotton for resale.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Fatmata is in her late twenties and married with two children between two and four. She runs a general merchandise business in Tombo, a Western rural area in Sierra Leone. 

She's been in this business since 2000 and sells soda, milk, cigarettes and pure water to her community. She says that the main problem for her business is lack of capital to expand.

Fatmata requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more soda, milk, cigarettes and pure water to sell. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and improve her standard of living. In the future, she would like to buy a plot of land. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more soda, milk, cigarettes and pure water to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama mujeres unidas, ya que eso es lo que son todas ellas, son unidas y trabajan desde hace cinco ciclos. Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Zulma, ella tiene una peluquería en su casa y  el crédito lo pide para la compra de cosméticos para la peluquería. Ella en su última encuesta de eliminación de pobreza se encontraba con buenos ingresos, pero de igual manera sigue muy entusiasmada esforzándose, ya que es consciente que debe mantener su logro.
 También se debe destacar el trabajo de las asesoras, quienes hacen un seguimiento permanente de capacitaciones y verificaciones que de alguna manera exigen y al mismo tiempo incentivan a las mujeres a luchar para poder progresar continuamente.
texts.en:
This group is named united women, since that is what they all are, they are united and have worked for 5 cycles. One of the members is Zulma. She has a hair salon in her house, and she is requesting the loan for the purchase of cosmetic products for the hair salon. In her last survey of poverty elimination, she had a good income, but in the same way she continues to be very enthusiastic putting forth efforts, since she is conscious that she should maintain her success. 

She also should highlight the work of her assistants, who do a permanent series of trainings and tests, that in some way demand and at the same time give incentives for the women to fight to make progress continuously.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetic products for a hair salon.

loans.name: Mujeres Al Progreso Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mujeres Al Progreso está en su ciclo 1º del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. El grupo lleva ese nombre ya que todas quieren progresar y salir adelante para así también ayudar a sus familias.
Saturnina es parte de este grupo, ella al igual que sus compañeras está esforzándose, y quiere capacitarse para seguir mejorando en su trabajo. Comenta que se dedica a la venta de ropas de todo tipo y que por medio de esto está saliendo adelante y ayuda a su familia.
Hoy Saturnina pide de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas de todo tipo, para que por medio de ello pueda seguir surtiendo a sus clientes y ofrecerle así una gran variedad.
texts.en:
The group Women to Progess is in its first cycle of the program of the women's committee, where they all work and help each other move forward. The group has this name because they all want to make progress and move forward in order to also help their families. 

Saturnina is part of this group. Just like her fellow members, she is putting forth effort, and she wants to train in order to continue improving in her work. She comments that she makes a living by selling clothes of all types and that through this she is moving forward and helps her family. 

Today Saturnina is asking for this loan in order to invest it in the purchase of clothing of all types, and through it she will be able to continue providing for her customers and offer them a big variety.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell.

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Este grupo llamado Las Emprendedoras está en su ciclo número 5 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. A través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo ellas se encuentran mejorando su situación de pobreza.
Edita es la presidenta del grupo, ella siempre apoya a sus amigas y les insta a seguir luchando y trabajando por mejorar cada día más. Ella tiene un comedor donde deleita a sus clientes con todo tipo de ricas comidas que ella hace, es una persona muy hábil y con gran talento para la cocina.
Ella solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de verduras, carnes, harina, condimentos y demás productos para poder seguir haciendo sus ricas comidas. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo de ir creciendo.
texts.en:
This group called the Entrepreneurs is in its fifth cycle of the program of the women's committee, where they all work and help each other to move forward. Through the efforts and continuous work they are improving their poverty situation. 
 
Edita is the president of the group. She always supports her friends and urges them to continue fighting and working to improve more every day. She has a small restaurant where she delights her customers with all types of delicious food that she makes. She is a very skilled person and with much talent for cooking. 

She is requesting this loan in order to be able to invest it in the purchase of vegetables, meat, flour, condiments, and other products in order to be able to continue making her delicious food. She is thankful for the opportunity that she is receiving to continue growing.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, meat, flour, condiments, and other products.

loans.name: Medalla Milagrosa 2 Group

texts.es:
El grupo está en su ciclo número 3 del programa de comité de mujeres, están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde ninguna se encuentran con ingresos muy bajos, pero aun así se están esforzando por salir adelante y crecer en lo que cada una hace.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Laura, entre el trabajo que ella hace cuenta se dedica a la venta de perfumes, y aunque las ventas de repente están difíciles no pierde la fuerza y las ganas, ya que todo hace por su familia.
Ella hoy solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de perfumes de variadas marcas, con lo que podrá seguir creciendo y mejorando su variedad de productos.
texts.en:
The Medalla Milagrosa 2 Group' is in the third cycle of the program. They are involved in the Poverty Stoplight survey. None of them are in the very low income category, but even so they are struggling to get ahead, each in their own field. 

One of the members is Laura. One of the things she does is selling perfume. Although her sales suddenly have become difficult, she has not lost her strength and desire, as all she does is for her family. She is requesting this loan to buy a variety of brands of perfume, so she can continue to expand her business and have a better variety of products.

loans.use: to buy perfumes to sell.

loans.name: Manos Laboriosas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Manos Laboriosas hizo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza para poder conocer la situación que cada una está pasando. Vicenta es una de ellas, y por medio de la costura es que está saliendo adelante.
Ella es una persona que está esforzándose por ir mejorando su vida, al igual que sus compañeras es muy activa y tiene muchas ganas de aprender.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas e hilos, que le permitirá poder seguir atendiendo a sus clientes y cumpliendo con sus pedidos. Ellas están muy agradecidas por la oportunidad que están recibiendo.
texts.en:
The group called Manos Laboriosas did the poverty elimination survey to better know the situation that each of them is going through. Vicenta is one of them, and she getting ahead through sewing.  

She is a person who is striving to improve her life. Like the other members, she is very active and is really eager to learn. She is asking for this loan to be able to invest in buying fabric and thread. This will allow her to keep serving her customers and filling her orders. They are very grateful for the opportunity they are receiving.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread for sewing.

loans.name: Telmo Wilian

texts.es:
William tiene 43   años de edad, su estado civil es unión libre, tiene dos   hijos vive con su esposa e hijos en el CantónVentanas  Provincia de Los Ríos. 

La descripción de la ventanilla es VRC Palmasola, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Palmasola, pertenece  a la parroquia Ricaurte, Cantón Urdaneta, se dedican a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

William se dedica a la  agricultura, siembra de maíz y arroz. Solicita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes. insumos, abonos. 

Con el apoyo del crédito podrá  comprar los fertilizantes a menor precio por ser al contado.  

Las  compras lo realizan  en Ricaute cada semana.   

Su sueño es comprar un terreno. Su desafío son los cambios climáticos. 
 
En sus tiempos libres le gusta jugar indor.
texts.en:
William is 43 years old. He is in a common law marriage. He has two children and lives with his wife and children in the Ventanas canton, Los Ríos province.  

The Palmasola communal bank is located in the community of Palmasola. It belongs to the Ricaurte parish, Urdaneta canton. They work in agriculture and with livestock. 

William works in agriculture. He plants corn and rice. He is asking for the loan to buy fertilizer, manure and materials. With the support of the loan, he will be able to buy the fertilizer at a lower price because he is paying upfront. He makes his purchases in Ricaurte every week.

His dream is to buy some loan. His challenge is weather changes. In his free time he likes to play indoor soccer.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure and materials.

loans.name: Asya

texts.en:
Asya lives in the village Lchashen in the Gegharkunik region. Asya is married and has a son and a daughter; both of them are already students. Asya’s husband is a taxi driver and despite his day and night working, he hardly manages to provide for his family's living. Asya has a vocational education and after taking special courses to be a hairdresser she has established her own business. She is running her business in rented space. She has all the needed equipment and stuff for her hairdressing activities. Today her beauty salon is very famous in their village and she is well known as she is doing different hairstyles professionally and with good taste.   

Asya asks for a loan of 500,000 Armenian drams in order to diversify her business and to start selling perfume in her salon. This will allow Asya to increase her family’s income in the near future.

loans.use: to buy perfume and thus to diversify her business activities

loans.name: Hawanatu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 29-year-old Hawanatu from Tombo, in the Western rural area in Freetown. She is married and blessed with two children between the ages of two and ten. 

Hawanatu runs a cookery business at home. She sells cooked food at her house. She has been running this business since she lost her mother. She works at the business throughout the week, from morning to night. Hawanatu says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation and insufficient financing to expand.

Hawanatu has requested a loan in order to buy more cooking items like rice, palm oil and cooking seasonings. The extra income from this loan will allow her to take care of herself and her children's welfare and increase her business. In the future, she plans to expand her cookery business. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more cooking items like rice, palm oil and cooking seasonings.

loans.name: Rodolfo Fernando

texts.es:
Rodolfo tiene 31   años de edad, su estado civil es unión libre, tiene dos hijos vive con su esposa e hijos en el Cantón Ventanas  Provincia de Los Ríos. 


La descripción de la ventanilla es VRC Palmasola, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Palmasola, pertenece  a la parroquia Ricaurte, Cantón Urdaneta, se dedican a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.


Rodolfo se dedica a la  agricultura, siembra de maíz y arroz. 

Solicita el crédito para comprar fertilizantesy una bomba a motor. 

Con el apoyo del crédito podrá  comprar los fertilizantes y la bomba a un precio menor por ser al credito.  

Las  compras lo realizan  en Ventanas  cada semana.   

Su sueño es aumentar la productividad. Su desafío son los cambios climáticos.  

En sus tiempos libres le gusta jugar indor.
texts.en:
Rodolfo is 31 years old. He is in a common law marriage and has two children. He lives with his wife and children in the Ventanas canton, Los Rios province. 

The communal bank is called Palmasola. It is located in the community of Palmasola. It belongs to the Ricaurte parish, Urdaneta canton. They work in agriculture and raising livestock.  

Rodolfo works in agriculture, He plants corn and rice. He is asking for the loan to buy fertilizer and a motorized grease. With the help of the loan, he will buy the fertilizer and the pump at a lower price. He makes the purchases in Ventanas every week.  

His dream is to increase productivity. His challenge is the weather changes. In his free time, he likes to play indoor soccer.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and a motorized pump.

loans.name: Jury Tatiana

texts.es: Tatiana, con tan sólo 23 años de edad, es casada y tiene un hijo de 2 años. Se dedica a trabajar medio tiempo en una veterinaria, pero, con la idea de generar recursos extra de manera independiente, ella decide iniciar la venta de mercancía como ropa interior, perfumería, cremas corporales, entre otros, actividad que realiza hace 6  meses; adicionalmente, presta el servicio de peluquería en su vivienda; todo esto le genera los ingresos suficientes para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar. La titular es una joven enérgica, activa, emprendedora y con proyección hacia el cumplimiento de sus objetivos, para lo cual requiere el apoyo del crédito con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de mercancía al por mayor (perfumería, cosméticos, cremas corporales, lencería) y herramientas de trabajo de peluquería (plancha para el cabello, secador) con esto podrá tener más variedad de productos disponible para ofrecer a sus clientes y, además podrá prestar un mejor servicio de belleza con las herramientas adecuadas, lo que se verá reflejado en el aumento de su clientela y por ende el incremento en sus ingresos. Es de esta forma como Tatiana avanza hacia el cumplimiento de su principal meta que es montar su negocio en un local comercial bien ubicado y poder disfrutar de una mejor calidad de vida al lado de su familia.
texts.en:
Tatiana, only 23-years-old, is married and has a 2-year-old son. She works part time at a veterinarian, but she has the idea of generating extra income independently. She decided to start selling merchandise such as lingerie, perfumes, body creams, among other items. She has performed this activity for 6 months. Furthermore, she has a hair salon in her home. This generates enough income to support her husband with the financial burden of the household. 

The owner is a young energetic, active, enterprising and works toward meeting her objectives, which requires a loan in order to invest in buying wholesale merchandise (perfumes, cosmetics, body creams, lingerie) and hairdressing tools (hair straighteners, hairdryer). With this she can have a greater variety of products available to offer their customers and also can provide better beauty service with the right tools. This will be reflected in increasing her clientele and thus an increase in her revenues. It is in this way that Tatiana moving towards fulfilling her main goal to set up her business in a good commercial location and enjoy a better quality of life with her family.

loans.use: to buy wholesale merchandise (perfumes, cosmetics, body creams, lingerie) and hairdressing tools (hair straighteners, hairdryer)

loans.name: Serina

texts.en:
Serina is 29 years old and lives in Montserrado County, which is known for its fishing industry. Serina is single and has three children who are between the ages of five and fifteen. Her children are in school and live at home. 

For the past four years, Serina has been selling food at the community market. She sells rice, garlic, oil, pepper, and other items. Serina describes herself as a hardworking woman. She was able to finish high school before starting her business. She established her business with a small amount of money which she saved over the course of a year in her susu (local daily savings account).  

Serina does not face any problems with her business, but she is thinking of expanding it even more. Serina is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, garlic, oil, pepper, and other food items for her business. She hopes to build a house and educate her children.  She pleased to be a BRAC Liberia borrower.

loans.use: to purchase rice, garlic, oil, pepper, and other food items for her business

loans.name: John Ufredo

texts.es:
John tiene 34   años de edad, su estado civil es unión libre, tiene dos hijos vive con su esposa e hijos en el Cantón Ventanas  Provincia de Los Ríos. 

La descripción de la ventanilla es VRC Palmasola, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Palmasola, pertenece  a la parroquia Ricaurte, Cantón Urdaneta, se dedican a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

Jhon se dedica a la  agricultura, siembra de maíz y arroz. 

Solicita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes y una bomba a motor. 

Con el apoyo del crédito podrá  comprar los fertilizantes a menor precio por ser al contado.  Las  compras lo realizan  en Ventanas  cada semana.   Su sueño es aumentar la productividad. Su desafío son los cambios climáticos.  
En sus tiempos libres le gusta jugar indor.
texts.en:
John is 34-years-old, he is in a civil union, has two children and lives with his wife and children in the Cantón Ventanas province of Los Ríos (the rivers). The name of the community bank is Palmasola VRC. It is located on the premises Palmasola and belongs to the parish Ricaurte, Cantón Urdaneta. The members work in agriculture and livestock.

John is dedicated to agriculture, sowing corn and rice. He is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and a pump motor. With the support of the credit, he may buy fertilizer at a lower price in cash. The shopping is done in Ventanas weekly.  His dream is to increase productivity. His challenge is the climate change. In his spare time he likes to play indoor soccor.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and a pump motor

loans.name: Lenin Daniel

texts.es:
Lenin tiene 27 años de edad, su estado civil es unión libre,  tiene dos hijos convive con su esposa en el Cantón Ventanas  Provincia de Los Ríos.
 
La descripción de la ventanilla es VRC Palmasola, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Palmasola, pertenece  a la parroquia Ricaurte, Cantón Urdaneta, se dedican a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

Lenin se dedica a la  agricultura, siembra de maíz y arroz. 

Solicita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes, insumos, abonos. 
Con el apoyo del crédito podrá  comprar los fertilizantes a menor precio por tratarse de ser al contado.  

Las  compras lo realizan  en Ventanas  cada semana.   

Su sueño es aumentar la productividad. Su desafío son los cambios climáticos.  

En sus tiempos libres le gusta jugar futbol.
texts.en:
Lenin is 27-years-old, he is is cohabiting with a partner, he has two children and lives with his wife in the Cantón Ventanas province of Los Ríos (the rivers). The name of the community bank is VRC Palmasola, which is located on the premises of Palmasola and belongs to the parish Ricaurte, Cantón Urdaneta.  The members work in agriculture and livestock.

Lenin is works in agriculture, sowing corn and rice. He is applying for a loan to buy fertilizers, supplies and manure. With the support of the loan he can buy fertilizer at a lower price because it will be paid in cash. The shopping is completed in Ventanas every week. His dream is to increase productivity. His challenge is the climate change. In his spare time he likes to play soccer.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, supplies, and manure.

loans.name: Shelline

texts.en: Shelline lives in the Kongowea area near Mombasa, Kenya. She is 32 years old and married. She has been in the dressmaking business for the last five years and the business is doing great. She is seeking a loan to buy lining material and thread for business purposes. She also sells utensils to earn some income from it. She wants to be an employer in the next five years. The major setbacks in the business are competition from other businesses and low season. She learned of Milango through friends and now she decided to join so that she could access credit to fund her business. The extra income that she raises from the business will improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy lining material and thread

loans.name: Jimmy Rafael

texts.es:
Rafael tiene 41  años de edad, es soltero,  tiene dos hijos convive con sus padres   en el Cantón Ventanas  Provincia de Los Ríos. 

La descripción de la ventanilla es VRC Palmasola, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Palmasola, pertenece  a la parroquia Ricaurte, Cantón Urdaneta, se dedican a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

Rafael se dedica a la  agricultura, siembra de maíz y arroz. 

Solicita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes, abonos. 

Con el apoyo del crédito podrá  comprar los los insumos a menor precio por ser al contado.  

Las  compras lo realizan  en Ventanas  cada semana.   

Su sueño es aumentar la productividad. 

Su desafío son los cambios climáticos. 
 
En sus tiempos libres le gusta pasar en casa con la familia.
texts.en:
Rafael is 41 years old, single, and has two children. He lives with his parents in the canton of Ventanas, in the province of Los Ríos. He belongs to the Palmasola communal bank, which is located in the rural area of Palmasola, which belongs to the parish of Ricaurte and the canton of Urdaneta. This communal bank focuses on agriculture and livestock.

Rafael works in agriculture, growing corn and rice. He is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers and manure. He says that with the support of the loan he will be able to buy agricultural inputs at a lower price because he will be able to pay cash. He will make his purchases in Ventanas each week. He says that his dream is to increase his productivity, and that the challenge he faces is climatic change. He likes to spend his free time at home with his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and manure.

loans.name: Maritza Maria

texts.es:
Maritza tiene 53  años de edad, es soltero,  convive con sus padres e hijos  en el Cantón Urdaneta  Provincia de Los Ríos. 

La descripción de la ventanilla es VRC Palmasola, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Palmasola, pertenece  a la parroquia Ricaurte, Cantón Urdaneta, se dedican a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

Maritza se dedica a la  agricultura, siembra de maíz. 

Solicita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes, abonos. 

Con el apoyo del crédito podrá  comprar los insumos a menor precio por ser la compra al contado.  

Las  compras lo realizan  en Ventanas  cada semana.   

Su sueño es aumentar la productividad. Su desafío son los cambios climáticos. 
 
En sus tiempos libres le gusta pasaren casa con la familia.
texts.en: Maritza is 53 years old, single and lives with her parents and her children in the village of Urdaneta, province of Los Ríos. She belongs to Palmasola community bank located in the precinct of Palmaola, Ricaurte parrish in Urdaneta, where the people make a living in farming and livestock. Maritza makes a living in farming, growing corn. She is requesting the loan to purchase manure and fertilizers. With the support of the loan, she can buy the supplies with cash for a lower price. She makes her purchases in Ventanas every week. Her goal is to increase her productivity. Her challenges are changes in climate. She likes being at home with her family in her free time.

loans.use: to purchase manure and fertilizers.

loans.name: Michael

texts.es: Michael es un joven muy trabajador, esforzado y quiere brindar apoyo económico a su familia, se dedica a la agricultura, necesita comprar almácigo de café (plantas pequeñas) para reforestal y renovar su cafeto, está solicihtando cuatrocientos mil colones (¢400.000) con este dinero comprará las plantas de café, fertilizantes y otros insumos para obtener una buena cosecha.
texts.en: Michael is a very hard-working and strong young man who wants to provide economic security for his family. He is a farmer. He needs to buy young coffee plants to replant and renovate his plantation. He is requesting four hundred thousand CRC ( 400.000 CRC ) to use to buy the coffee plants, fertilizer and other supplies in order to have a good harvest.

loans.use: to buy young coffee plants.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen es una señora de 40 años de edad quien quiere ver superados académicamente a sus hijos, ella matriculó a sus dos hijos en  un curso de cómputo y necesita adquirir una computadora para que ellos realicen los trabajos que les asignen en su casa, solicita trescientos cincuenta mil colones (¢350.000) para comprar dicho equipo. Manifiesta su gran alegrLa de poder contar con este apoyo económico.
texts.en: Carmen is 40 years old and wants to see her children excel academically. She enrolled her two children in a mathematics and calculation course, and she needs to buy a computer so that they can do the homework that they are assigned to do at home. She is requesting 350000 CRC to buy a computer. She says she is very happy to be able to count on this economic support.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Gladys Silvia

texts.es:
Gladys tiene 78  años de edad, su estado civil es unión libre, tiene  dos  hijos,  convive con su espoo e hijos  en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 

La descripción de la ventanilla es VRC Palmasola, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Palmasola, pertenece  a la parroquia Ricaurte, Cantón Urdaneta, se dedican a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

Gladys se dedica a la  agricultura, siembra de maíz  y cría de pollos y chanchos. 

Solicita el crédito para comprar los fertilizantes, morocho, povillo. 

Con el apoyo del crédito podrá  comprar los fertilizantes y la comida de los animales a menor precio por ser al contado.  

Las  compras lo realizan  en Ventanas  cada semana.   

Su sueño es aumentar la productividad. 

Su desafío es la competencia.  En sus tiempos libres le gusta pasar en casa con la familia.
texts.en: Gladys is 78 years old, has a common-law husband and two children. They live together in the village of Ventanas, province of Los Ríos. She belongs to Palmasola community bank located in the precinct of Palmasola, parrish of Ricaurte in the village of Urdaneta, where the people make a living in farming and livestock. Gladys makes a living in farming, growing corn and raising chickens and pigs. She is requesting the loan to purchase fertilizers and animal feed. With the support of the loan she will be able to purchase the supplies with cash for a lower price. She makes her purchases every week in Ventanas. Her goal is to increase her productivity, and a challenge is the competition. She likes to be at home with her family in her free time.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and animal feed.

loans.name: Yadira

texts.es: Yadira es una madre trabajadora, tiene que trasladarse en vehículo hasta su trabajo , ya que debe regresar temprano a su hogar para atender a sus hijos menores de edad, labora a 8 kilómetros de su casa, para lograr esto depende de su vehículo pues sus hijos son su prioridad, por esta razón necesita urgentemente comprar los repuestos para reparar su vehículo ya que está descompuesto, solicita setecientos mil colones (¢700.000)con este préstamo comprará dichos repuestos y pagará la mano de obra. ella manifiesta su agradecimiento por la oportunidad financiera que se le brinda.
texts.en: Yadira is a hardworking mother. She has to travel by car to get to work since she must get home quickly to tend to her young children. She works 8 kilometers from home. She depends on her car because her children are her priority, and it's for this reason she urgently needs to purchase parts to repair her car, which is broken down. She is requesting the loan to purchase these parts and pay for labor. She expresses her gratitude for the financial opportunity that is being provided.

loans.use: to repair her vehicle.

loans.name: Noris Fátima

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo conocida como la Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos desde épocas coloniales se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal “17 de Julio”.

En este lugar vive la señora Noris, tiene 50 años, está casada  y tiene tres hijos, dos mayores de edad y la menor estudia en universidad. Su marido es chofer.

Doña Noris es una ama de casa que para obtener ingresos propios y con esto pagar los estudios de su hija menor se dedica  a la venta de productos Yanbal, sabanas, edredones, entre otras cosas, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su casa donde sus clientes llegan cuando necesitan algún producto, ella lleva más de 12 años dedicada a esta actividad con la cual a ha podido pagar los estudios de sus hijos que es lo más importante para ella.

Este crédito es para comprar sabanas, edredones y cosméticos. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 10 años y le gusta porque los créditos le permiten financiar su negocio. 

Su sueño es que su hija sea profesional.
texts.en:
In the City of Portoviejo, known as the City of the Royal Tamarinds since colonial times, the “17 de Julio” communal bank meets every two weeks.

Noris lives here.  She's 50 years old, married, and has three children; two are adults and the youngest studies at university.  Her husband works as a driver.

Nora is a housewife who sells Yanbal brand products, sheets, quilts and other things in order to earn an income to pay her daughter's tuition.  She sells door to door and also from her home, where her customers go when they need something.  She has been doing this for 12 years and she has been able to pay for her children's education, which is most important to her.

This loan is so that she can buy sheets, quilts, and cosmetics.  She's been with the communal bank for 10 years and she likes it because the loans allow her to finance her business.

Her dream is for her daughter to become a professional.

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Xinia

texts.es: Xinia es una mujer muy esforzada, ha salido adelante en los proyectos que ha emprendido con esfuerzo propio y con el financiamiento que ha obtenido en otras ocasiones con los programas de apoyo comunal. Ella está urgida de reparar su vivienda porque estamos ya en época lluviosa y tiene problemas de filtración de agua y otras dificultades que arreglar. Solicita un crédito de setecientos mil colones (¢700.000), con este dinero comprará los materiales de construcción para realizar la reparación.
texts.en: Xinia is very hardworking. She has done well in the projects she has undertaken through her own effort and with the financing she has previously obtained through communal support programs. She is in urgent need of repairing her home, because it is already the rainy season and she has problems with a water leak, as well as other problems she needs to fix. She is requesting a loan of 700000 CRC, with which she will buy construction materials to make the repairs.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Didier

texts.es: Didier se ha dedicado durante varios años a la siembra y cosecha de hortalizas, esta es la mejor época para cultivar dicho producto. por esta razón Didier solicita un crédito por un millón de colones (¢1.000.000) para comprar la semilla, los fertilizantes, pues ya tiene preparado el terreno paqr ainiciar la siembra. Didier manifiesta su alegría porque con este apoyo financiero puede realizar su prooyecto.
texts.en: Didier has been working sowing and harvesting vegetables for a few years. Now is the best season to farm this product. For this reason, Didier requests a million colones (¢1.000.000) loan in order to purchase seeds and fertilizers since he already has the plot of land ready to start sowing. Didier is happy because with the financial support of this loan he will be able to accomplish this project.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Sulema

texts.es:
Sulema continúa participando en el banco comunal “Virgen de Chanca” y con la crianza de animales menores como chanchos, ovejas y venta de comida. 

Sulema agradece infinitamente a todos los inversionistas que le apoyaron con el anterior préstamo pues le fue muy bien y pudo comprar animales menores entonces en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar, fideos, aceite y otras cosas más. 

Sulema nació en el distrito de Challabamba y vive en el mismo distrito donde nació. (El distrito de Challabamba está ubicado en la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco, Perú). Ella tiene 36 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos.
texts.en: Sulema continues being a part of the Virgen de Chanca communal bank, raising small animals like pigs and sheep, and selling food. Sulema is infinitely grateful to all of the lenders who supported her with her previous loan, which was used to buy small animals and went very well. At this time she is requesting a loan to purchase merchandise like sacks of rice, sacks of flour, noodles, oil and many other items. Sulema was born in the district of Challabamba and still lives there. (Challabamba is located in the province of Paucartambo, department of Cusco, Peru). She is 36 years old and has a common-law marriage, from which she has three children.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like sacks of rice, sacks of sugar, noodles, oil, and other things.

loans.name: Emelda

texts.es:
La señora Emelda  de 33 años de edad, vive con su hijo y su esposo en su casa de habitación ubicada en una aldea de  Nacaome al sur de Honduras.
Doña Emelda se dedica a su actividad que es la  venta de productos de la canasta básica como ser arroz, frijoles, manteca, huevos, refrescos etc. se dedica a esta actividad desde hace ya varios  años.
Doña Emelda su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación y sus clientes sus vecinos y todas las personas que le visitan en su negocio vecinos a su comunidad.
Doña Emelda está solicitando el préstamo para comprar más productos de abarrotería como azúcar, arroz, frijoles, café, leche, pan, manteca, etc. quiere llenar un poco mas su negocio y tener de los productos que le busquen.  Tiene deseos de salir adelante y con el apoyo de este préstamo pretende seguir aumentando más el inventario de su negocio.
Doña Emelda su sueño es ampliar su pulpería y instalar un depósito de frescos. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras-  Julio del 2013
texts.en: Emelda is 33 years old and lives with her husband and her son in their home located in the town of Nacaome in southern Honduras. Emelda has made a living selling basic groceries like rice, beans, lard, eggs, drinks and other items for a number of years. Emelda's business is located in her home, and her customers are neighbors and all the people who come to her community. She is requesting the loan to purchase more grocery products like sugar, rice, beans, coffee, milk, bread, lard and other items. She wants to stock her business a little more and have the products her customers seek. She wants to keep making headway, and with the support of the loan will be able to keep growing her inventory. Emelda's dream is to expand her store and set up a drink stand.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, beans, coffee, milk, bread, lard, etc.

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es: Rafael es padre de familia y trabaja a 15 kilómetros de su casa, los fines de semana se dedica a ofrecer sus servicios como mensajero  en los centros comerciales de su provincia,para lo cual usa una motocicleta prestada, ya que necesita aumentar sus ingresos pues su salario es la única entrada económica en su hogar, también usará la motocicleta para trasladarse al trabajo,  ya que le queda bastante lejos del lugar donde vive. Solicita ochocientos mil colones (¢800.000) para adquirir dicho medio de transporte.
texts.en:
Rafael's the father of a family.  He works 15 kilometers from his house.  On the weekend he works as a messenger in the business districts in his province, for which he uses a borrowed motorcycle.

He needs to increase his income because his salary is the only money coming into the household.  He'll also use the motorcycle to get to work because it's quite far from where he lives.

He's requesting 800,000 colones [CRC] to acquire a means of transportation.

loans.use: to buy a vehicle for work

loans.name: Geomara Geoconda

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo conocida como la Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos desde épocas coloniales se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal “17 de Julio”.

En este lugar vive la señora Geomara, tiene 34 años, está casada  y tiene 5 hijos de 17, 16, 14, 6 y 2 años de edad, los tres estudian en colegio y uno en una escuela de la ciudad. Su marido es comerciante.

Doña Geomara con su marido tienen una bodega en su casa en la cual distribuyen agua por toda la ciudad, mientras ella vende en su local el esposo se desplaza en un carro por toda la ciudad entregando en colegios y tiendas de la localidad, así como también a domicilio o en instituciones, ellos venden este liquido vital en todas las presentaciones desde bidones hasta agua en funda. Llevan más de 8 años dedicados a esta actividad la cual les permite salir adelante y darle lo necesario a su familia.

Este crédito es para comprar agua en todas las presentaciones y surtir su negocio. Esta desde hace dos años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda y beneficios que reciben de la institución. 

Su sueño es que sus hijos tengan una buena educación.
texts.en:
In the City of Portoviejo, known as the City of the Royal Tamarinds since colonial times, the “17 de Julio” communal bank meets every two weeks.

Geomara lives here.  She is 34 years old, married, and has five children, ages 17, 16, 14, 6 and 2.  They all attend school.  Her husband is a merchant.

Geomara and her husband have a store in their home from where they distribute water all around the city.  Her husband makes deliveries to neighborhoods, stores, installations and homes around town by car, while she sells from the shop.  They sell this vital liquid in all forms.  They’ve been doing this for more than eight years and it allows them to get ahead and provide for their family.

This loan is so they can buy water in different forms and stock their business.  She has been with the communal bank for two years and she likes it because of the assistance she gets from the installation.

Her dream is for her children to get a good education.

loans.use: to buy water.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 48 years old and is married to Lucy who is also a farmer. They have two children aged twenty and nine years old.

He has been practicing farming in Ndunyu Njeru for the past thirteen years and has applied for his first loan from KADET LTD to enable him buy fertilizer. He plans to expand his tailoring business and also to pay for school with the anticipated profit.

In the near future, Peter hopes to see his children well educated and his farming and tailoring businesses grow.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Anibal Ramon

texts.es:
Aníbal tiene 32 años de edad, su estado civil es unión libre. Tiene un hijo, vive con su hijo y su mujer en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 

La descripción de la ventanilla es VRC Avanza, sus miembros se dedican a la agricultura, todos viven en el sector del recinto Aguas Frías.
Prácticamente se han criado en esa zona. Se dedican a labores agrícolas o pecuarias en su mayoría.

Anibal se dedica a la agricultura, siembra de maíz, a la cría de pollos y chanchos. 

Solicita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes, insumos, abonos. Con el apoyo del crédito podrá comprar los fertilizantes al contado y a menor precio. 

 Las  compras lo realizan  Ventanas cada semana. 

 Su sueño es incrementar su capital.

 Su desafío es la competencia. En sus tiempos libres le gusta pasar con su familia.
texts.en:
Aníbal is 32 years old, in a common law marriage.  He lives with his wife and son in the Ventanas Settlement in the Los Ríos province.

The group is called VRC Avanza and its members are farmers.  They all live in the Aguas Frias area.  They have practically been raised in this zone and most farm and raise livestock.  Aníbal is a farmer, raises corn and also chickens and pigs.

He is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, supplies, and compost.  With the help of this loan he will be able to buy in cash for a better price.

He makes his purchases in Ventanas each week.

His dream is to increase his capital.

His challenge is the competition.  He likes to spend his free time with his family.

loans.use: to buy supples.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional bags of charcoal to stock his business

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Violet has a retail shop business in Kangundo town and has been running it for the past two years.
She is 40 years old and married with four children. Besides having the retail shop, she also does farming.

This being her first loan term with KADET LTD, she plans to use the amount to buy more stock of goods to sell in her shop. These include rice, flour, cooking oil, and milk. She will use the generated income to buy a dairy cow.

In the future, Violet hopes to grow her business, open a wholesale shop, and be able to improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of rice, flour, and sugar.

loans.name: Glenda Isabel

texts.es:
Glenda tiene 28 años de edad, es soltera, tiene cuatro hijos, vive con sus hijos en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 

La descripción de la ventanilla es VRC Avanza, sus miembros se dedican a la agricultura, todos viven en el sector del recinto Aguas Frías.
Prácticamente se han criado en esa zona. Se dedican a labores agrícolas o pecuarias en su mayoría.


Glenda se dedica a la agricultura, siembra de maíz. 

Solicita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes, insumos, abonos. Con el apoyo del crédito podrá comprar los fertilizantes a menor precio por ser al contado.  

Las  compras lo realizan en Mocache y Ventanas cada semana.  

Su sueño es incrementar su capital. Su desafío es la competencia. En sus tiempos libres le gusta  pasar con sus hijos y su familia.
texts.en:
Glenda is 28 years old, single and has four children.  She lives with them in the Ventanas settlement of the Los Ríos province.

The group is called VRC Avanza and its members are farmers. They all live in the Aguas Frias area. They have practically been raised in this zone and most farm and raise livestock.  Glenda raises corn.

She is asking for this loan to buy fertilizer, supplies, and compost.  With the help of this loan she will be able to pay in cash and get better prices.

She makes her purchases in Mocache and Ventanas each week.

Her dream is to increase her capital.  Her challenge is the competition.  She likes to spend her spare time with her children.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen has been providing an auto maintenance service in Akhuryan village for many years. He lives with his wife and father and does his best to sustain their living. After several years of hard work, Armen already owns his own small place where he repairs different types of vehicles and cars. Armen has requested a loan from local financial institutions several times but without any success. His loan request was rejected every time because his business isn't registered as a formal business. 

Armen has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. This loan is very important for Armen to renovate his car and purchase tools specialized for his work. Armen will be very grateful to Kiva lenders for supporting him with the business which he does with great care and love and which is the only source of his income.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of his car and to purchase tools for the repair of vehicles.

loans.name: Darío Alberto

texts.es: Darío, a sus 57 años de edad es padre de un hijo de 11 años y vive en unión libre con su pareja. Desde muy joven conoció la actividad de la producción y venta de alimentos debido a que le ayudaba a sus padres y hermanas realizando esta actividad. Desde hace 12 años montó su propio negocio, siguiendo la tradición familiar de producir y vender alimentos y para ello recibe apoyo de su esposa, con esto ha generado ingresos suficientes para el sostenimiento de su familia. Darío es un señor emprendedor, activo, luchador y con gran esmero trabaja arduas jornadas de Lunes a Domingo de 6:00 am a 9:00 pm con el fin de aprovechar el tiempo al máximo para vender sus productos. El prestatario siempre va en busca de opciones que le permitan salir adelante, y ve en el crédito un apoyo para continuar avanzando y alcanzar sus objetivos, el crédito será invertido en la compra de utensilios de cocina (ollas grandes) e insumos (verduras, carne, harina, aceite); con esto podrá darle continuidad a su negocio incrementando su producción para satisfacer toda la demanda que tiene, pues sus productos son reconocidos en el sector. Darío sueña con fortalecer su negocio para que le permita generar mejores ingresos y de esta manera brindarle mejor educación a su hijo, para que tenga un futuro próspero.
texts.en: Darío, at the age of 57, is the father of an 11-year-old son, and he lives in free union with his partner. From a very early age, he was acquainted with producing and selling food, because he helped his parents and sisters do this work. Twelve years ago he set up his own business, following the family tradition of producing and selling food, and for that he receives the support of his wife. With this business, he has generated sufficient income to support his family. Darío is an entrepreneurial man, active and striving, and he works with great care for arduous workdays from Monday to Sunday from 6:00 am to 9:00 pm, with the goal of using his time to the maximum to sell his products. This borrower always goes in search of options that allow him to advance, and he sees in the loan a means of support to continue advancing and reach his goals. The loan will be invested in the purchase of cooking utensils (big pots) and supplies (vegetables, meats, flour, oil); with this he will be able to give continuity to his business, increasing his production to satisfy all the demand that he has, since his products are recognized in his district. Darío dreams of strengthening his business so that it allows him to generate more income and in this way offer a better education to his son, so that he can have a prosperous future.

loans.use: to buy cooking utensils (big pots) and supplies (vegetables, meat, flour, oil)

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith lives in the Muranga area of Kenya, which produces coffee for export. She has three children and has been doing this work for eight years. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, tea, crops, and her personal business.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'The freedom to engage in other activities.' Her biggest challenge is 'High input prices and lack of a reliable market.'  The animals on the farm have been given no names.

Faith was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: 'Because I want loans for farming.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'Microfinance is for small-scale projects.'

Her highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked 'How will this loan benefit her family?', Faith replied 'I will be able to expand my farming projects.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Faith owns the following: cow, poultry, and pump, but does not own a pig, bicycle, motorcycle, or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household: mosquito net, electricity, running water, sewing machine, TV, and DVD, but does not have solar power.

loans.use: to purchase water tanks.

loans.name: Princess

texts.en:
This is 24-year-old Princess who lives in Montserrado County; this county is the number one producer of fish on the Liberian market. She has completed the ninth grade and is single. She has a six-year-old child living at home and attending school. 

Princess has been selling pens, cups, spoons and plates in the community market for more than seven years now. She considers herself to be a hard working mother. She started this business by selling charcoal for her oldest sister and later established her own business with the little money that her sister gave her. For now, fewer goods on her table are the problem that she is faced with. She is a happy mother because her business provides for her and her child. She is requesting a loan to purchase more pens, cups, spoons and plates to increase her customers’ purchasing options. 

She plans to build her house and educate her child. She is very happy with the lenders who are supporting BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more pens, cups, spoons and plates to increase her customers’ purchasing options.

loans.name: Kohe

texts.en:
Kohe is a 49-year-old man from a location known as Gitwembe which is found in Migori County in the western part of Kenya. He supports ten people in his family and is a married man; they have seven children who are 20, 17, 15, 13, 10, 8 and 4 years old respectively.

Kohe does farming and sells farm inputs. He has been doing this business for the last eight years and gets a monthly income of 10,000 KES. He is applying for his first loan with KADET LTD which he will use to boost the business. He will use the anticipated profit to plow back into the business.

Kohe's dream is to educate his children, expand the business for commercial purposes and practice modern farming techniques.

loans.use: to purchase farm materials.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 27-year-old lady from the Migori region which is located in the western part of Kenya. She supports six people in her family and is married to Leonard who is also a businessman from the same location. They have four children who are 10, 9, 5 and 3 years old respectively.

Rose operates a retail shop where she sells shoe products. She has been doing this business for the last five years and gets a monthly income of 60,000 KES. She is taking her sixth loan with KADET LTD which she will use to expand the business. She will use the anticipated profit to plow back into the business.

Rose's dream is to become stable in her business and raise enough income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more shoe soles and laces.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel continua con la venta de productos hechos de plásticos como tazas, bolsas, platos y tambien con la vende frutas como manzanas, duraznos. 

Maribel agradece infinitamente a todos los inversionistas que le apoyaron con el anterior préstamo pues le fue muy bien y pudo comprar mercadería entonces en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar manzanas.

Maribel nació en el distrito de Challabamba y vive en el mismo distrito donde nació. (El distrito de Challabamba está ubicado en la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco, Perú). Ella tiene 27 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos.
texts.en: Maribel continues selling plastic products like cups, bags and plates, as well as selling fruits like apples and peaches. She is infinitely grateful for all the lenders who supported her previous loan, which was used to purchase merchandise and went very well. At this time she is requesting a loan to purchase apples. Maribel was born in the district of Challabamba and still lives there. (It is located in the province of Paucartambo, department of Cusco, Peru). She is 27 years old and has a common-law husband with whom she has two children.

loans.use: to buy apples.

loans.name: Maureen

texts.en: Maureen lives in Kongowea, Kenya. She is 25 years old and married with one child. She operates a beauty salon in the market. She has been in this business for around five years. Her husband is employed, and he supports her in the business. She hopes that that the business grows large in the next five years. The major challenges she has been facing in the business are competition from other business and funding her business. She knew of Milango through friends, and now she seeks a loan to buy beauty products like weaves and wigs for resale. The extra income she will raise will help her in education and health. The income will improve her standard of living as well.

loans.use: to buy beauty products like weaves and wigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and re-plant his fields.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina was born in the city of Luga which is in the Russian Federation. She received her higher education in pedagogy again in Russia in the small city of Pskov. After several years she finally came back to her native city, Kapan, and became a teacher of Armenian history. Marina is a widow and she lives alone. Her daughter is married and she lives separately and her son lives in Yerevan where he simultaneously works and studies. Marina works at the local school and at the same time at her home she gives paid courses in Armenian history.

Marina needs the loan amount, which is 300,000 Armenian drams, to buy a computer which she will use with her pupils during their courses.

loans.use: to buy a computer which she will use with her pupils during their courses

loans.name: Dato

texts.en:
Dato is 34 years old. He lives in the village of Naghobilevi, West Georgia, with his wife, two children and parents. Several times, he has asked for loans from local financial institutions to start up a new business, without success. His loan requests were rejected each time because of low income and lack of experience in his job, which is usually demanded by local credit providers. The income source for the family is the agricultural business run by Dato. He owns a citrus garden, grows kiwi fruits, nuts and maize, and sells the harvest at the local market. Besides that, the family breeds two calves and takes good care of them. Dato’s father is a truck driver and gets a transportation service fee per month.

Dato has requested a loan from Credo to start trading in fruit and vegetables. His loan request was approved as part of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides business start-ups and re-startups with credit with soft conditions to the vulnerable poor who do not have access to credit products, since they are regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With the received credit, Dato will purchase fruits and vegetables in East Georgia, where prices are low, and sell the products in his district with a price mark-up. He will use his own van to make deliveries. Dato plans to increase the turnover in his trade business gradually. With this loan, the family will generate enough income to access regularly available credit products in the country’s capital market, in the event they need it.

loans.use: to start trading in fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Irma

texts.en:
Irma is a 45-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and two children. She has been working as a tailor since 1990. She has extensive experience in this occupation. She is most talented at repairing stuff, as she ends up with a very good quality result, as if the product is quite new. Her husband works in security, and he is the main income source of the family. 

Today, Irma is requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase a new sewing machine. She estimates that the loan will help her improve her skills and increase her profits by 15%. In the future, Irma wants to borrow more Kiva loans with the aim of opening her own tailoring factory.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Zepeer

texts.en:
Zepeer is a 28-year-old married woman. She is from Lebanon and is living with her husband and only child. She has worked as a beautician since 2006.
 
She welcomes customers at her house and from time to time she visits them to serve them at their domiciles. With her youth loan requested from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l., she will purchase nail polish equipment and a hair remover machine. Even with her husband’s monetary cooperation, the family is still suffering from an unsatisfactory financial situation, and Zepeer states that she desperately needs the loan to help her earn a higher income and be able to improve the family’s living standards.

loans.use: to purchase nail polish equipment and a hair remover machine

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit is 52 years old, and she lives with her husband in Vanadzor city. Anahit has a son who is already married and lives separately with his family. Anahit has a higher education; she has graduated from Vanadzor State Pedagogical Institute in the faculty of Armenian Language and Literature. Today she works at the school as a teacher of Armenian language and literature. She is a very loved and respected person in the school, both by the pupils and by the teaching staff. She likes her work very much, and she does her best to pass interesting, intellectual lessons full of precious knowledge both of our language and our literature masterpieces of different periods. 

Anahit also gives paid courses at home to pupils studying for the entrance examinations. Anahit asks for a loan of 500,000 Armenian drams to buy a computer, which will help her to develop her educational programs both for school and for her individual courses.

loans.use: to buy a computer, which will help her to develop her educational programs both for school and for her individual courses.

loans.name: Kumba

texts.en:
Kumba is 40 years old. She lives and works in Buchanan Area, the capital city of Grand Bassa County, located by the sea. It is well-known for its beaches and delicious fish. Many logging companies are also based in the city. Residents of the city love eating fufu, cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce. Most people in the city are Bassa speakers, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia. 

Kumba is single. She did not go to school and has five children between 20 and 30 years old, all of whom are living on their own. For the past 25 years, she been selling flour, rice, pepper, oil, etc., in the local market. She started this business with a little amount from her mother, and she learned this business from her friends. She likes her business because of the ways customers buy from her. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more flour, rice, pepper, oil, etc., for her business. She hopes to have more money to sustain her family.

loans.use: to purchase more flour, rice, pepper, oil, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a farmer in Kangundo town where she plants cash crops as well as keeps cattle. She sells the farm produce which includes maize, beans and vegetables at the market place and has been in this business for three years. She is 34 years old and married with three children. 

This is her third loan term and she plans to use the amount to buy cow feed for her cattle. She also plans to buy farm inputs. These include fertilizer and seeds. She will use the generated income to pay school fees for her children.

Josephine hopes to buy more cattle and become a successful livestock farmer, make more income and be able to install electricity in her home.

loans.use: To buy cattle feed and farm inputs.

loans.name: Raed

texts.en:
Raed is a 25-year-old single man. In 2009, he launched his new business, which consists of selling men's clothes. His store is located next to his house, and he welcomes customers from nearby areas and villages. 

Today, he is looking to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to diversify his merchandise selection and purchase new clothes such as T-shirts, jeans, etc., from different brands and trends. He notes that selling good quality clothes will help him attract more customers and augment his sales, and thus, his income. In the future, he plans to expand his business and target a wider clientele.

loans.use: to purchase new clothes.

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en:
Mamie lives in Airport area. She is 33 years of age, and she stopped her education in the 7th grade. She is married, and her husband is a security guard. They have three children who are between the ages of 9 and 15, all of whom live at home and attend school. 

For the past four years, she been dressing hair in the local market. She started this business with money given to her by her husband and learned this way of selling from friends. She enjoys the business because of the experiences she receives every day. She asked for a loan to purchase more artificial hair to attract more customers. Her plan is to build a shop in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more artificial hair to attract more customers.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.es:
