Cirila continúa con la crianza de animales menores, la ganadería, la agricultura y la venta de comida, ella tiene un puesto de venta de comida en uno de los mercados de la ciudad de Challabamba. 

Cirila agradece infinitamente a todos los inversionistas que le apoyaron con el anterior préstamo pues le fue excelente y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar, fideos, aceite, verduras y otras cosas más. 

Cirila nació en el distrito de Challabamba y vive en el mismo distrito donde nació. (El distrito de Challabamba está ubicado en la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco, Perú). Ella tiene 42 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos.
texts.en:
Cirila continues to raise small animals and cattle and is involved in agriculture and selling food. She has a food stand in one of the markets of Challabamba. 

Cirila is infinitely grateful to all the investors who supported her in her previous loan, which went excellently. She now requires a loan to purchase groceries such as bags of rice, bags of sugar, pasta, oil, vegetables and other items.

Cirila was born in Challabamba and still lives in the same district today. Challabamba is located in the Paucartambo province in the department of Cusco, Peru. Cirila is 42 years old and lives with her de facto with whom she has three children.

loans.use: to buy groceries such as bags of rice, bags of sugar, pasta, oil and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to replant, fertilise and provide crop maintenance.

loans.name: Monigue Dite Saran

texts.fr:
Madame Monigue Dite Saran est née vers 1966 à Misseni sous-préfecture de Kadiolo (cercle de Loulouni). Mère de 1 enfant elle réside avec son époux et leurs enfants dans une grande famille traditionnelle élargie à Kaboïla II Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Madame  Monigue Dite Saran mène il y a environ six ans  les activités d’achat et de vente des pagnes wax, draps, chaussures, des balaies et tissus brodés. Elle mène son activité à son domicile et de façon ambulante dans la ville de Sikasso où elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a maintenant trois ans. Elle est à son  troisième prêt individuel avec lequel elle compte acheter 15 pièces de pagnes wax, 10 paires de chaussures de qualités différentes, 5 complets de tissus brodés et des balaies. Elle achète ses marchandises sur place et à Bobo Dioulasso (au Burkina Faso) avant de les revendre en détail de façon ambulante au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée essentiellement des femmes. Les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 90 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Monigue Dite Saran was born around 1966 in Misseni in the Kadiolo sub-prefecture (Loulouni circle). She is mother to one child and lives with her husband and their children in a large extended traditional family in Kaboïla II Sikasso (the Republic of Mali's third administrative region).

For around six years Monigue Dite Saran has been buying and selling "pagnes wax" (highly decorative and colorful pieces of fabric), sheets, shoes, brooms and embroidered fabrics. She carries out her activity from home and on a door-to-door basis in the town of Sikasso where she is in great demand from her customers owing to the quality of her products.

In order to be able to increase her ever-growing customer demand, she decided to join the micro-finance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, three years ago. She is on her third individual loan with which she is planning to buy 15 "pagnes wax", 10 pairs of shoes of varying quality, five sets of embroidered fabric and brooms. She buys her goods locally and in Bobo Dioulasso (in Burkina Faso) before reselling them door-to-door on a retail basis, for cash and on credit, to a customer base made up principally of women. The previous loans she has had have been fully repaid.

Thanks to this loan she is expecting to make a monthly profit of 90,000FCFA, which will be used to increase her business, contribute to the family expenses and repay the interest on her loan.

loans.use: to buy various articles.

loans.name: Abdusamad

texts.ru: У него трудное условия жизни и низкий доход, но доброе сердце и хороший нрав. Он -Абдусамад из Таджикистана, которому 43 года, женат и на воспитании имеет 5 детей. Более 15 лет он занимается выращиванием сельхоз культуры, как лук, пшеницу, морковь, арбуз и т.п. Полученный доход он продает на рынке. Так как у него высококачественный урожай, так и его товары имеют большой спрос. Его жена Марзия помогает ему в ведении бизнеса. С целью обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами он хочет развевать свой бизнес, а для этого он должен получить больше урожая. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 10000  сомони, чтобы купить минеральные удобрения, семена и оплатить наёмным работникам. Доход, который он будет получать от бизнеса, будет использовать для образования своих детей и улучшения условия жизни. Он нуждается и ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
He has a hard life and low income, but keeps a kind heart and good disposition. He is Abdusamad from Tajikistan - 43 years old, married, and raising 5 children. For over 15 years, Abdusamad has been cultivating crops such as onions, wheat, carrots, watermelon etc. He sells his harvest at the market, where his quality produce is in high demand. Abdusamad's wife Marzia helps with the business.

In order to provide his family with all necessities of life, Abdusamad wants to keep developing his business. To this end, he must increase his harvest. He is requesting a loan of 10,000 somoni in order to purchase mineral fertilizers and seeds, and to pay his hired labourers. Abdusamad will use his business profits for his children's education and to improve the family's quality of life. In his hour of need, he is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and seeds, and to pay his workers

loans.name: Lola

texts.ru: Лола женщина, которая имеет трудную судьбу. Ее муж бросил ее с 1 ребенком и женился на другой женщине. Лола сама воспитывает и обеспечивает своего ребенка. Ей 38 лет. Она более 10 лет работает в пожарной станции. Она честная и трудолюбивая женщина и поэтому является одной из успешных работников. Лола всегда старается дать максимум возможностей для своего ребенка. Ее дитя учится в университете, и она должна оплатить за учебный договор. Лола данное время не имеет достаточно денег. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 сомони для оплаты учебного договора. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие. Этот займ поможет ребенку, который растет без отца получить образование.
texts.en:
Lola has had a difficult life. Her husband abandoned her and their child to marry another, and so Lola is raising her child alone. She is 38 years old. For over 10 years, she has worked at a fire station. She is an honest and hard-working woman and a valued employee.

Lola always try to provide her child with maximum opportunity. Her child attends university, and Lola must pay the tuition, for which she presently has no money. She is requesting a loan of 2000 somoni to pay for her child's education. She awaits your kindness and counts on your compassion. This loan will help a fatherless child receive an education.

loans.use: to pay for her child's education

loans.name: Zuhro

texts.ru: Зухро 50 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Она более 17 лет работает в государственной организации контролером. Она любит свою работу и честно выполняет свою работу. Зухро и ее муж ели-ели справляются с семейными расходами, так как они имеют маленькую зарплату. Всю свою жизнь они посвятили своим детям и их благополучия. Скоро они собираются провести свадьбу одного из своих детей. Свадьбу они планируют провести по всем таджикским обычаям. Зухро запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 сомони для проведения свадебного торжества своего ребенка. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие. Это ее первый займ с КИВА и его партнера ИМОН. Она очень честная женщина.
texts.en:
Zuhro is 50 years old. She is married and has 4 children in her care. For over 17 years, she has worked as a controller in a government office. She likes her job and conscientiously performs her duties.

Zuhro and her husband can barely make ends meet due to their small salaries. They have dedicated their entire lives to the well-being of their children. Soon, the couple are going to hold a wedding for one of their children, according to all Tajik customs. Zuhro is requesting a loan of 1000 somoni to help with organizing the festivities. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your compassion. This is her first loan from Kiva and the field partner IMON. Zuhro is a very honest woman.

loans.use: to hold wedding celebrations for her child

loans.name: Rokia

texts.fr:
Madame Rokia  est née Vers 1969 à Kadiolo. Mère de 8 enfants, elle réside avec son époux et leurs enfants dans une famille nucléaire à Hamdallaye, un des  quartiers périphériques de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Madame  Rokia mène il y a environ dix ans  les activités d’achat et de vente des pagnes wax, draps de lits, de chaussures, des tissus brodés, etc. Elle mène son activité à son domicile et de façon ambulante dans la ville de Sikasso où elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a maintenant un an. Après  plusieurs prêt solidaires dans une association des femmes de sa localité, elle est à son  troisième prêt individuel avec lequel elle est compte acheter 10 pièces de pagne wax, 10 paires de chaussures de qualités différentes et 3 complets de tissus brodés. Elle achète ses marchandises sur place et à Bobo Dioulasso (au Burkina Faso) avant de les revendre en détail de façon ambulante au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée essentiellement des femmes. Les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 55 000 FCFA qui sera pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en: Rokia was born around 1969 in Kadiolo. The mother of 8 children, she lives with her husband and children in a nuclear family in Hamdallaye, one of the outlying suburbs of Sikasso town (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Rokia has been buying and selling various items like wax pagnes (highly colourful and decorative West African cloth), bedsheets, shoes and embroidered fabrics for about 10 years. She does her business at home as well as selling on the streets of Sikasso town, where she is much in demand by her customers because of the quality of her products. She decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso a year ago in order to be able to satisfy her growing clientèle. After several group loans she received as a member of a local woman's association, she is on her 3rd individual loan, which she plans to use to buy 10 bolts of wax pagnes, 10 pairs of shoes of mixed quality, and 3 embroidered outfits. She gets her supplies locally and in Bobo Dioulasso (in Burkina Faso) before reselling the items on the streets, for cash or credit, to a retail clientèle essentially made up of women. Her previous loans have been properly repaid. Thanks to this loan, she expects to make an average monthly profit of 55 000 francs which will be used to contribute to the family expenses and to repay the interest on her loan, and the rest will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy 10 bolts of wax pagnes, 10 pairs of shoes of mixed quality, and 3 embroidered outfits.

loans.name: Salika

texts.fr:
Âgé de 38 ans, Monsieur Salika est un j célibataire  qui réside chez son feu père à Médine, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
    Monsieur Salika  après avoir mené beaucoup d’activité sans succès, il s’est initié à cette activité d’achat et de vente des téléphones portables et leurs accessoires (façade, batterie, chargeur, écouteur, etc.) des radios et des téléviseurs  depuis plus de cinq ans. Il mène son activité au grand marché de Sikasso où il dispose d’une boutique aux abords du goudron sur la route RN7. Monsieur Salika est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, Il décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a environ une année et il est à son premier prêt individuel. 
    Avec ce premier prêt, il compte acheter 10 téléphones portables de marques différentes, 5 radios de marques différentes, 5 téléviseurs 2 cartons de façade, 10 chargeurs, 10 paquets de carte mémoire, 5 pendules, 2 cartons de batterie et 1 douzaine d’écouteur. 
   Il s’approvisionne à Bamako et les revend à une clientèle composée généralement des jeunes et surtout des forains qui viennent aux foires hebdomadaires tous les Samedi et Dimanche.
   Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en: Salika is 38 years old, single and lives at his late father's place in Médine, one of the popular districts of Sikasso town (3rd administrative region of the republic of Mali). Having had several failed businesses, Salika started selling mobile phones and accessories (covers, batteries, chargers, earphones, etc.), radios and televisions over 5 years ago. He does his business at the Sikasso Grand Market where he has a shop located on the side of the tarmaced RN7 road. Salika is much in demand by his customers because of the quality of his products. He decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution about a year ago with a view to better satisfying his growing customer base and is on his first individual loan. He plans to use this loan to buy 10 mobile phones of different brands, 5 radios of different brands, 5 televisions, 2 boxes of covers, 10 chargers, 10 packets of memory cards, 5 pendulums, 2 boxes of batteries and a dozen sets of earphones. He gets his supplies in Bamako and resells them to a clientèle mostly made up of young people, especially the fairground people who come to the weekly markets every Saturday and Sunday. Thanks to this loan, he expects to make a monthly profit of 100 000 francs which will be used to contribute to the family expenditures and pay off the interest on his loan, and he will reinvest the rest in his business.

loans.use: to buy various electronic items and accessories.

loans.name: Siaka

texts.fr:
Âgé de 33 ans, Monsieur Siaka est marié et père de 2 enfants, il réside avec son épouse et leurs enfants  dans une grande famille traditionnelle à Hamdallaye, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
    Monsieur  Siaka  après avoir mené beaucoup d’activité sans succès,  s’est initié il y a environ quatre  années à cette activité d’achat et de vente des charbons des bois et de bois de chauffe. Il ‘approvisionne  dans les localités environnantes de Sikasso dont il dispose de son propre tracteur pour leurs transports. Il est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, Il décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a environ deux années et il est a son sixième prêt individuel, les cinq prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
    Avec ce sixième prêt, il compte acheter 10 chargements de charbons de bois, 10 chargement de bois de chauffe et des pièces de recharges et l’entretien de son tracteur. 
   Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 200 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en: Siaka is 33 years old, married and the father of 2 children. He lives with his wife and their children in a large traditional family in Hamdallaye, one of the popular districts of Sikasso town (third administrative region of the republic of Mali). Having had several failed businesses, he started buying and selling charcoal and firewood about 4 years ago. He gets his supplies from the surrounding villages and has his own tractor with which to transport them. He is much in demand by his customers because of the quality of his products. He decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution about 2 years ago in order to be able to better satisfy his growing clientèle and is on his 6th individual loan. The 5 previous loans have been correctly repaid. He plans to use this 6th loan to buy 10 loads of firewood and some spare parts for his tractor, and to pay for maintenance on it. Thanks to this loan, he expects to make a monthly profit of 200 000 francs which he will use to build up his working capital, contribute to the family expenses and repay the interest on his loan.

loans.use: to buy 10 loads of firewood, tractor spare parts and maintenance.

loans.name: Taghrid

texts.en:
Taghrid is a 23-year-old Lebanese single woman. In 2009, in order to help her family financially, she started to work as a beautician. She works on a freelance basis and she also visits customers at their domiciles to provide them with her talented beauty services. 

Today, Taghrid is asking to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase cosmetics and a machine designed for nail polish usage. She is well-known in her region and neighboring towns due to her good reputation. She is certain that with the new services that she will provide, she will be able to attract more customers and therefore increase her income. 

In the future, Taghrid hopes to open her own beauty salon where she will receive her customers appropriately.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics and a machine designed for nail polish usage.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 24 years old and married with one child. She sells eggs in Nairobi's environs and she has been in this business for one and a half years. She sells eggs both retail and wholesale.

This being her first loan with KADET LTD, Irene plans to buy more stock of eggs to sell in her business. She will use the anticipated income from her business to expand her shop as well as provide for the basic needs of her family.

Irene hopes to grow her business and thereafter open a shopping mall.

loans.use: To buy more stock of eggs to sell.

loans.name: Milton

texts.es:
Milton continúa con la venta de un plato de comida especial llamado Pollos a la Brasa entonces él continua con su pollería y le va muy bien. Milton agradece infinitamente a todos los inversionistas que le apoyaron con el anterior préstamo pues le ayudo con el capital del negocio entonces en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más insumos como por ejemplo pollos y papas. 
 
Milton nació en el distrito de Challabamba y vive en el mismo distrito donde nació. (El distrito de Challabamba está ubicado en la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco, Perú). Él tiene 45 años de edad, es casado y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene tres hijos.
texts.en: Milton still sells a special dish called grilled chicken and so he still runs his chicken food outlet which is doing very well.  Milton is eternally grateful to all the investors who provided support in the form of the previous loan which helped him with capital for his business.  On this occasion he is seeking a loan to buy more supplies such as chickens and potatoes.  Milton was born in the district of Challabamba (in Paucartambo province in Peru's Cusco department) and that is still his home today.  He is 45 and married with three children from this beautiful relationship.

loans.use: to purchase more supplies, such as chicken and potatoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 3 quintals of fertilizer, 3 liters of herbicide, and 1 liter of insecticide. Another part of the loan will be used to stock her mini-store a little more.

loans.name: Sanyah

texts.en: Sanyah is 34 years old and lives in the Airport area with her three children who are between the ages of 3 and 12. They are in school and live at home. For the past fourteen years she has been running a table where she sells delicious frozen goods such as chicken, chicken feet, pig's feet,  and fish. Some of the problems she is facing are complaining customers (about the high price of food). She says she makes lot of profit. She started this business with help from her mother and learned this way of selling from her.  She is requesting a loan to buy more chicken, chicken feet, pig's feet, and fish for her business. Her plans are to educate her children and build a house.

loans.use: to buy more chicken, chicken feet, pig's feet, and fish for her business,

loans.name: Miriam De Jesús

texts.es:
Miriam con 64 años de edad es casada y madre de 3 hijos. Desde que se casó se dedicó al cuidado de su familia como ama de casa, siempre estuvo pendiente de la educación y el bienestar de sus hijos. Hace 7 años decidió buscar opciones que le permitieran generar ingresos por cuenta propia, por lo cual comenzó a vender productos por catálogo a sus familiares, amigos y vecinos del sector donde reside. “Comencé a vender productos por catálogo para cambiar de actividad y sentirme útil ahora que mis hijos son adultos, además me gusta porque la marca de los productos que vendo es muy reconocida y tiene trayectoria en el mercado  y a la gente le gusta”, así Miriam expresa su satisfacción al realizar esta actividad.
Actualmente solicita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de mercancía (cremas corporales, cosméticos, lociones, cremas faciales)  con el fin de aprovechar los descuentos que obtiene por compra al por mayor y tener variedad de productos disponible para ofrecer a sus clientes; esto le permite aumentar el margen de ganancia por venta y podrá darle continuidad a su negocio, de esta manera no se verá limitada económicamente y podrá ayudar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar.
texts.en:
Miriam is 64 years old. She is married and the mother of 3 children. Since she married she has taken care of her family as a housewife. She was always looking after the education and well being of her children. Seven years ago, she decided to seek advice on how to generate income on her own, and that is how she started to sell catalog products to her relatives, friends and neighbors in the area where she lives. “I started to sell products by catalog for a change of pace and now I feel useful, since my children are adults. I also like it because the brand of products that I sell is very well known and had a market share and people like it." That is how Miriam expresses her satisfaction while doing this activity.

Right now, she is asking for the loan to invest in buying merchandise (body creams, cosmetics, lotions, facial creams) in order to take advantage of the discounts she gets from buying wholesale and to have a variety of products available to offer her customers. This will allow her to increase her sales profit margin and continue her business. This way, she won't be limited financially and she can help her husband with the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as face creams, cosmetics, lotions, and body creams.

loans.name: Ruhsora

texts.ru: Рухсора 37 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Дети Бахромджон, Рухсора и Иномджон. Ее дети еще не совершеннолетние Она более 19 лет занимается бизнесом. Рухсора имеет большой опыт по введению бизнеса. Она начала бизнес купле продажей клеёнки. Она постепенно развевала свой бизнес. Данное время она расширила свой бизнес. Она дополнительно теперь продает банки и крышки. Ее муж помогает ей введению бизнеса. Рухсора хочет пополнить оборотный капитал и увеличить доход. С полученного дохода, она планирует улучшить условию проживания. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 долларов США для покупки банки и крышки. Она уже 3 цикл кредитуется в ИМОНе и во время погасила предыдущие займы. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Ruhsora is 37 years old. She is married and is raising three children. Her children's names are Bakhromjon, Ruhsora and Inomjon. Her children are not yet fully grown. She has been doing business for more than 19 years. Ruhsora has a lot of experience starting a business. She started a business buying and selling oilcloth. She gradually developed her business. She recently expanded her business. She is now also selling jars and lids. Her husband is helping her to establish her business. Rukhsora wants to augment her working capital and increase her revenue. With the received revenues, she plans to improve her living conditions. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 3000 USD to purchase jars and lids. She is already in her third lending cycle with IMON and repaid her past loans on time. She awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: To purchase jars and lids to increase her working capital

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina is 49 years old and lives in the Airport Community. She is married with four children, aged between 21 to 31. They all live on their own and attend school. For the past 15 years, Regina has been running a oven which she fixed and sells bread in her community. She uses a taxi whenever she is going to get her stock, and then sells from Monday to Saturday, spending 13 hours everyday on her business. She started this business with money given to her by her husband and learned this way of selling from her mother. She is appreciative of her business because she keeps her savings every day and makes her popular. Her plans are to build a house in future. She is requesting a loan to purchase more butter, flour, sugar etc for her business. Regina would like to says thanks to the supporters of BRAC Liberian.

loans.use: to purchase more butter, flour, sugar etc for her business.

loans.name: Dúo Solidario Los Claveles De Vista Hermosa Group

texts.es:
DUO SOLIDARIO LOS CLAVELES DE VISTA HERMOSA
Este grupo está a cargo de la señora María Sandra quien se dedica a la confección de ropa de tela variada  como camisas. Pantalones, short para damas, caballeros y niños.  Tiene varios años en este negocio y al lado de su esposo e hijos desean ser unos grandes empresarios del país.  Doña Sandra tiene varios pedidos y sus clientes la buscar mucho porque ella hace un trabajo muy excelente con las prendas.  La tela que tiene no le alcanza y necesita comprar más porque tiene varios pedidos y no le quiere quedar mál a sus clientes, por eso nuevamente pide un préstamo más para poder comprar la tela que necesita y así no quedarles mal a sus clientes.espera le puedan ayudar con el credito solicitado.
texts.en:
DUO SOLIDARIO LOS CLAVELES DE VISTA HERMOSA
This group is run by María Sandra who uses various fabrics to make clothing such as shirts, trousers, and shorts for men, women and children.  She has been doing this for a number of years and she and her husband and children want to be leading business people in the country.  Sandra has several orders and her customers greatly prefer her because of the excellent quality of the clothing she produces.  The fabric which she currently has is insufficient and she needs to buy more because she has a number of orders and she does not want to let down her customers. Therefore, she is seeking another loan to buy the fabric she needs and avoid letting her customers down.  She hopes that you can help her by granting the loan she has applied for.

loans.use: to buy fabric for making and selling clothing

location.town: Aldea Vista Hermosa, San Pedro Sacatepequez

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 40-years-old married man, with three children, who are in school. He has been in the hawking business for one year and has applied for his first loan from KADET Ltd to enable him buy wardrobe mirrors, ladies jewellery and cosmetics, among others for sale. With the anticipated profit, he plans to open a shop where he can sell his stock. John hopes to stabilize his business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy wardrobe mirrors, ladies jewellery and cosmetics for sale

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka appreciates the previous loan she received, which allowed her to purchase more chicks and thus increase her poultry production. In addition, she has a fish selling business that she operates.

She is requesting a loan of KSH 40,000 to purchase dry fish and cooking oil for resale. She joined Yehu to access these funds.

loans.use: to purchase dry fish and cooking oil for resale

loans.name: Lungujja Kwekulakulaya Group

texts.en: Florence is 35 years old resident of Lungujja, and is married with four children. She has a very big responsibility of taking care of her children by providing them with better education, shelter, clothing and medical care since her husband is jobless. Florence operates a small restaurant along the road and this is where she has earned a living that has sustained her family.She will use the loan to buy utensils for her restaurant. She has been in this business for two years and has a dream of setting up a bigger restaurant. Florence’s major challenge is lack of enough capital to purchase better quality utensils, chairs for her customers and for her restaurant. Her neighbors have commented that she is hardworking, resilient and dedicated, which is the reason she is the group chairperson. She urges fellow women to be creative and hard working such that they can adequately provide for their families.

loans.use: to buy utensils for her restaurant

loans.name: Frances

texts.en:
This is Frances from Liberia.  She resides in Buchanan, the capital City of Grand Bassa County.  The county is located by the sea and is known for their beaches and fish.  

She is 43 years old, and she is married with ten children.  Her children's ages are between 18 and 29.  Only two are currently living at home, and only one is in school.  

She has sold used clothes for over ten years.  She will use the loan to purchase more used clothes to increase her sales.  

On average, she works 9 hours a day at her business from Monday to Saturday.  She started this business with money from her husband. She transports her merchandise by bus.  She cites not having a shop as her biggest challenge.  Her favorite part of her business is the profit she makes every time.  In the future, she would like to a decent shop, and a house.  

She is grateful for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes to increase her sales.

loans.name: Amida

texts.ru: Амида умная и трудолюбивая девушка. Ей 21 года. Она не замужем и живет с родителями. Амида студентка Коммерческого Университета Таджикистана. Она учится по специальности юриста. После окончания средней школы она поступила в Профессиональный лицей и окончила успешно. После окончания лицея она поступила в университет. Она в университете учится тоже успешно. Амида начитанная и современная девушка. Она должна оплатить за учебный договор, но не имеет денег. Она запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Amida is a smart and hard-working young woman. She is 21 years old. She is unmarried and lives with her parents. Amida is a student at the Commercial University of Tajikistan. She is studying to be a lawyer. After graduating from secondary school, she enrolled in vocational school and successfully graduated from there. After finishing vocational school, she enrolled in university. She is also studying very well at university. Amida is a well-read and modern young woman. She should pay for her tuition, but she doesn't have the money. She is requesting a loan to pay for her university tuition. She awaits your kindness and relies upon your generosity.

loans.use: To pay for her tuition at university

loans.name: Ma-Watta

texts.en:
You are most welcome to meet 47-year-old Ma-Watta from Buchanan. Buchanan is the capital City of Grand Bassa County and is located by the sea.  It is well known for its beaches and delicious fish. Many logging companies are also based in the city. Residents of the city love eating fufu, a cassava based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce.  Most people in the city are Bassa speakers, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia. 
Ma-Watta did not go to school and she is married to a driver. She describes herself as a hardworking woman. They have 7 children aged between 9 to 23, of which only two are in school and live at home. 
Ma-Watta has a stable business where she sells cow skin.  She has been in business for 5 years and works from Monday to Saturday, spending 10 hours each day.  With this loan, she will buy cow skin to resell. One of the greatest challenges that she faces is less income. She transports her goods by shared-taxi. She started her business with money from her husband. She is proud of her business because of the profit she makes. Her future plan is to build a house. She thanks you in advance for your support!

loans.use: to buy cow skin for resale

loans.name: Sasun

texts.en: Sasun is from Kapan town, where he lives with his wife. It is already two years since Sasun has been involved in installation of heating systems. He provides this service to locals and gathers income which is vital for him to sustain his family. Sasun requested a loan from local financial institutions several times, but without any success. His loan request was rejected every time because his business isn't registered as a formal business. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. Sasun needs this loan to purchase specialized equipment for his work. This will help Sasun to provide better service to his customers and he will be able to sustain his family.

loans.use: to pay for specialized equipment for his work

loans.name: Nyepu

texts.en:
37-years-old Nyepu from Liberia lives and works in Buchanan, the capital City of Grand Bassa County, which is located by the sea.  It is well known for its beaches and delicious fish.  Many logging companies are also based in the city.  Residents of the city love eating fufu, cassava based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce.  

She completed 8th grade before starting her business,  She is married and has three children with ages between 5 and 17, all of whom are in school and  live at home.  For the past fifteen years, she has been selling dry meat, oil, fish, etc.  She started this business with money from her husband, and she learned this business from her mother. She likes her business because it makes her popular.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more dry meat, oil, fish, etc for her business.  She hopes to earn more money and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more dry meat, oil, fish, etc for her business

loans.name: Erik

texts.en:
Erik is 25-years-old and lives in small village called Aghvani, with his mother. 

One year ago Erik started to earn his living by providing taxi service to locals. Due to his hard and tireless work Erik has gained many loyal customers over this year and now is able to cover his and his mother's daily costs. Currently Erik's car is out of order and needs to be renovated. Erik requested a loan from local financial institutions several times, but without any success. His loan request was rejected every time because his business isn't registered as a formal business. Erik has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. 

The loan is very important for Erik to renovate his car, purchase tires and be able to continue his business.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of the car and purchase tires

loans.name: Cristhian

texts.es: El Sr. Cristhian   tiene 19 años, el se dedica a la venta de frutas su puesto de venta que se encuentra en la localidad de San Jose,   este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  va a usar este préstamo  para la compra de una motocicleta ya que esto le permitirá transportarse para realizar algunas compras para su negocio, El Sr. Cristhian  enfrenta retos en su negocio que el tener que transportarse distancias largas parea hacer sus compras y la compra de una motocicleta le ayudara a transportar sus productos para la venta , el Sr. Cristhian es un apersona joven que se esta iniciando en este negocio, se siente agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado ya que le brindan un oportunidad para crecer y ser una mejor persona.
texts.en:
Cristhian is nineteen years old and makes a living selling fruit at his stall in the town of San Jose.  

This is his first loan with the institution, and he is going to use it to purchase a motorbike.  This will allow him to transport himself in order to make purchases for his business.  Cristhian faces challenges in his business, and he has to travel long distances in order to buy products.  Purchasing a motorbike will help him to transport his products so that he can sell them.  

Cristhian is a young person, just starting out in this business.  He feels thankful to the institution for the support that has been offered to him.  This is an opportunity to grow and be a better person.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Ángel Humberto

texts.es: Ángel, con 51 años de edad, es casado y padre de 2 hijos. Durante la mayor parte de su vida productiva laboró como excavador en una mina, pero, debido al alto riesgo al que estaba expuesto decidió retirarse, para poder dedicarle más tiempo a sus hijos. Debido a la difícil situación económica que atraviesa su familia, Ángel decide iniciar su propio negocio, para lo cual ya consiguió una caseta en una zona muy transitada del sector donde reside, pero requiere el apoyo del crédito para invertirlo en la compra de un nevera, realizar adecuaciones locativas (pintura de la caseta) y comprar surtido al por mayor (mecato, galletería, confitería, gaseosas , productos lácteos); esto le permitirá obtener recursos para continuar sustentando las necesidades básicas en su hogar y además tendrá el manejo de su propio tiempo para dedicarlo a su familia. Ángel es un hombre luchador, pujante, dedicado a su familia, por esta quiere cumplir el sueño de terminar de cotizar las semanas requeridas para obtener su pensión para así garantizar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y bienestar.
texts.en:
Angel, 51 years old, is married and the father of two children. He worked as an excavator in a mine for most of his working life. However, due to the high risk associated with mining, he decided to retire from this profession and dedicate more time to his children. 

Because of difficult economic circumstances facing his family, Angel decided to start his own business. He obtained a sales stand in a very busy part of the area where he lives. However, he needs the help of a loan to invest in the purchase of a freezer, to do renovations to his place of business (by painting his stand), and to buy stock wholesale (snacks, cookies, pastries, soft drinks, milk products). This will allow him to earn enough income to continue to provide for the basic needs of his household. Furthermore, he will be in charge of his own time, so that he can devote it to his family. 

Angel is a hardworking and determined man who is dedicated to his family. For this reason, he wants to fulfill his dream and finish making the payments required to earn his pension, which will guarantee the wellbeing of his family and provide them with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a freezer, improve his sales stand, and to buy stock wholesale.

loans.name: Yulied Yurany

texts.es: Yurany es una mujer de 30 años de edad, casada y es madre de un hijo de 9 años. Actualmente se encuentra desempleada, lo que ha generado una crisis en la estabilidad económica de su hogar. Ella ha tenido experiencia laboral en el área de la salud, pero por falta de oportunidades de empleo, ella tomó la decisión de comenzar con su propio negocio y comprará una tienda de abarrotes que era propiedad de su hermana, quien lo tenía hace aproximadamente 6 años, por este motivo solicita el  crédito, para invertirlo en la compra del negocio, surtido (productos lácteos, mecato, gaseosas, aceite, productos de aseo) y pagará una asesoría especializada sobre el buen manejo de su negocio.  Yurany desea aprovechar esta oportunidad para obtener ingresos y así poder brindarle una mejor educación a su hijo, además cuenta con el apoyo de su hermana, quien le enseñará todo lo relacionado con la tienda, además quiere cumplir un sueño y es poder legalizar y acreditar el negocio en poco tiempo y ampliarlo, con el fin de prestarle un mejor servicio a los clientes y por ende mejorar la calidad de vida en su hogar.
texts.en:
Yurany is a 30 year old woman, married and the mother of a 9 year old son. 

She is currently unemployed, which has caused problems for her household's economic stability. She has experience working in the health industry, but because of a lack of employment opportunities she has decided to start her own business and will buy a grocery shop that belonged to her sister for about 6 years. This is why she is requesting a loan so she can invest it in buying the business, stock (dairy products, snacks, fizzy drinks, oil and bathroom products) and to buy specialized accessories for running her business. 

Yurany wants to take advantage of this opportunity to earn an income ad to be able to offer a better education to her son. She also counts on the support of her sister, who will teach her how to run the shop. She also wants to fulfill her dream and to legalize and accredit the business as quickly as possible and have it grow, with an eventual goal of providing better service to the customers and improving the quality of her home life.

loans.use: to buy a business, stock (dairy products, snacks, fizzy drinks, oil and bathroom products), and specialized accessories

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
LUIS tiene 26 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos vive con los padres en EL Cantón Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC la CHONTA, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto la Chonta, Pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

Luis se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz, Solicita el crédito para comprar herbicidas, fertilizantes, abonos. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo que le hace falta para la agricultura.
Las compras las realizará en Mocache. 

El sueño es propsperar junto a la familia. En el tiempo libre le gusta leer y ser competitivo.
texts.en:
Luis is 26 years old, single, and does not have children. He lives with his parents in the Ventanas neighborhood in the los Rios province. 

He is a member of the communal bank la Chonta, which is located in the la Chonta neighborhood, which belongs to the Ventanas district. They work in agricultural and livestock work. 

Luis works in agriculture sowing corn and rice. He is requesting the loan to buy herbicides, fertilizers, and compost. With the help of the loan, he will be able to buy what he needs for agriculture. He will make his purchases in Mocache. 

His dream is to prosper together with his family. In his free time he likes to read and be competitive.

loans.use: to buy herbicides, fertilizers, and compost.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La cliente reside en Playas.  Tiene 13 años vendiendo línea de cosméticos y le ha ido muy bien hasta ahora.  Lamentablemente, hace 1 año falleció su esposo, por lo que ha quedado a cargo de sus 3 hijos.  Trabaja de lunes a sábado, de 9 am a 5 pm.  Sus 3 hijos estudian en la escuela fiscal del sitio.  A futuro le gustaría poder incrementar su negocio, con la finalidad de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.  Necesita invertir el dinero del préstamo en la compra de cosméticos para su comercialización.
texts.en:
This borrower resides in Playas.  She has been selling a line of cosmetics for 13 years and has been doing very well up to now.  Unfortunately, her husband died a year ago and she is now in charge of taking care of her three children.  The borrower works Monday through Saturday from 9:00 A.M. to 5:00 P.M.  Her three children are studying at local state school.  In the future, she would like to increase her business in hopes of improving her family’s quality of life.  

She needs to invest the money from this loan in the purchase of cosmetics that she can sell.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Sevada

texts.en: Sevada is a taxi driver from Syuniq village. He is married and has 3-years-old daughter. Sevada has been providing taxi services to locals for many years and this business has become his main source of income. As the gathered income is hardly enough for covering his family's costs, Sevada has no money left for purchasing tools which he needs for his car. He requested a loan from local financial institutions several times, but without any success. His loan request was rejected every time because his business isn't registered as a formal business. Sevada has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. This loan is very important to purchase tools for his car and provide better service to his customers.

loans.use: to purchase specialized tools for his car

loans.name: Clara

texts.en: Clara is a Liberian. She resides in Buchanan, the capital City of Grand Bassa County. The county is located by the sea and is known for their beaches and fish. In addition, many logging companies are also located in the city. People in Buchanan are known in the country for their love of fufu, a cassava based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce. She is 31 years old. She and her fiancee live together, and they have two children aged 9 and 12, both of whom are currently living at home and attending school.  Clara has a shop where she sell blouses, lappa,(fabric) artificial hair etc for the past two years.  She will use the loan to purchase more goods such as blouses, lappa fabric, artificial hair etc. On average, Clara works ten hours at her business from Monday to Saturday. She started her business by selling for her mother. She transports her merchandise by bus.  She cites the rainy season as her biggest challenge. Her favorite part of her business is the money she makes. In the future, she would like to build a house and open a shop. She is grateful for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more goods such as blouses, lappa fabric, artificial hair etc

loans.name: Kona

texts.en: Kona is 45 years old and lives in Margibi County, which has the largest producing rubber plantation in Liberia. She and her fiancee have four children who are in school and between 30 and 22 years old. Her husband works at Firestone. She completed 5th grade before starting her business eight years ago. She described herself as a hard working woman. She received a little money from her husband to establish her business. She enjoys her business because she makes more profit and has more customers. She sells for ten hours six days a week. She is requesting a loan to buy more red oil, rice, pepper, bitter-ball, etc for her business. Her plans is to increase her business even more. She would like to say thanks to the supporters of BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to buy more red oil, rice, pepper, bitter-ball, etc for her business

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie is 45 years old. She lives and works in Buchanan, the capital City of Grand Bassa County, which is located by the sea.  It is well known for its beaches and delicious fish.  Many logging companies are also based in the city.  Residents of the city love eating fufu, cassava based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce.  

She and her fiancee live together. She completed grade 7 before establishing her business twelve years ago selling fish, chicken feet, pig feet, palm nuts, etc in the local market. She started this business with a little amount of help from her mother, and she learned this business from her sister. She is happy with the business.  She earns more money to help her fiancee with the children's schooling, and she also enjoys the interaction with her customers. She spends 8 hours at her business six days a week.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish, chicken feet, pig feet; palm nuts, etc for her business. Her prayer is to become an owner of houses. She hopes the supporters of BRAC Liberia will keep helping them.

loans.use: to purchase more fish, chicken feet, pig feet, palm nuts, etc for her business

loans.name: Luciano

texts.es: El señor Luciano tiene 39 años de edad, vive en la comunidad de Tiraque, actualmente vive junto a su familia en la misma comunidad, la vivienda que vive es rustico de material de barro con techo de teja, el préstamo que esta solicitando es para comprar los insumos agrícolas para la siembra de papa de este año, el señor Luciano tiene ganas de mejorar sus ingresos para obtener una mejor calidad de vida y de igual manera brindar una mejor calidad a su familia en los próximos años.
texts.en:
Sr. Luciano is 39 years old and lives in the community of Tiraque.  He currently lives with his family in the same community.  His rustic home is made of made of mud and has a tile roof.  

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy farming supplies for his potato crop this year.  Sr. Luciano wants to improve his income so that he can attain a better quality of life and provide the same for his family within the next few years.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies for his potato crop.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen, de 51 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de su esposo Gregorio y sus 2 hijas a las que cuida en su casa propia. Carmen se dedica a la agricultura y la compra y venta de animales, posee cerdos, ovejas, gallinas y vacas a las que cuida con mucha dedicación para comercializarlos a buen precio. Pero la actividad donde invierte mayor cantidad de capital económica es la agricultura, en los terrenos agrícolas que posee siembra habas, papa y maíz los cuales cuida con mucha dedicación con el apoyo de su esposo quien le ayuda a labrar la tierra y fertilizarlos , comenta que en un inicio dedicaba mucho esfuerzo a sus cultivos y no tenía buenos resultados, pero ahora con asesoría técnica los abona y fertiliza de manera constante y ello le ayuda a tener sembríos de calidad. Este es su segundo crédito con KIva y agradece el apoyo financiero recibido pues le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos, por ello promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.
Carmen, invertirá los S/.1000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Carmen, 51, is a hardworking woman.  She lives with her husband, Gregorio, and her two daughters, whom she takes care of in her own house.

Carmen makes a living in agriculture and buying and selling animals.  She has pigs, sheep, chickens, and cows.  She takes care of them with great care so she can sell them for a good price.

Farming is where she invest most of her financial capital, however.  On her farmland she grows beans, potatoes, and corn with great care and the help of her husband, who helps her cultivate and fertilize the land.

She says that in the beginning she worked very hard on her crops but didn't have good results.  Now, with technical advice, she constantly prepares and fertilizes them, which helps her have quality fields.

This is her second Kiva loan.  She's grateful for the financial help she has received because it allows her to improve her income, so she promises to make her payments punctually.

Carmen will invest the 1000 soles [PEN] in organic soil amendments to nourish her fields.

loans.use: to buy organic soil amendments

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es: El señor Ricardo tiene 44 años, vive en la provincia de Tiraque, actualmente vive junto a su familia en la misma comunidad, su casa es rustica de material de barro, don Ricardo es una persona humilde que se dedica a la producción agrícola, actualmente está solicitando el crédito para una reparación del tractor agrícola, el sr. Ricardo tiene ganas de incrementar sus ingresos económicos para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Sr. Ricardo is 44 years old and lives in the province of Tiraque.  He currently lives with his family in the same community.  His house is rustic and made of clay.  

Don Ricardo is a humble person who engages in agriculture.  He is currently requesting a loan so that he can repair his tractor.  Sr. Ricardo wants to increase his income so that he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to pay for tractor repairs.

loans.name: Sandra Paola

texts.es:
Sandra tiene 22 años de edad, es soltera, vive con su familia  en  el Cantón Chillanes Provincia Bolívar.

Sandra    se dedica a la costureria y el esposo trabaja en el campo.
 
Solicita el crédito para la compra de materiales para la construcción de su vivienda como cemento, ladrillos.

  Las  compras lo realizan en el Cantón Chillanes. Con el apoyo del crédito podrá comprar los materiales  al contado y a menor precio. 

Su desafío es mejorar su estado de vida. 

Su sueño es comprar un terreno para sembrar maiz y aumentar el negocio para mejorar su calidad de vida.  En el tiempo libre  le gusta  escuchar música y caminar.
texts.en:
Sandra is 22 years old, single and lives with her family in the Chillanes canton in the province of Bolívar. Sandra is a seamstress and her husband is a farmer.

She is requesting this loan to buy materials to build her home including cement and bricks. Her purchases will be carried out in the Chillanes canton. With the support of this loan, she will be able to buy the materials with cash and at a lower price. Her greatest challenge is to improve her standard of living. 

Her dream is to buy land to grow corn and improve her quality of life. In her free time she likes to listen to music and go for walks.

loans.use: to buy cement and bricks.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en: Shamim is a 44-years-old resident of Kyengera, who deals in selling fresh foods especially sweet potatoes. Shamim started the business in 2000 and hence has good experience. Shamim is requesting for a loan of 1,000,000 Uganda Shillings to buy more foods from the rural area at a cheaper price and then supply it in towns where she has a bigger customer base. Shamim sells mostly to restaurants, people in her vicinity and other neighboring suburbs. However, her challenges are inadequate capital and climatic conditions that change periodically. Shamim is a hardworking woman whom requires more money for a loan to boost her business so that it acquires steady growth.

loans.use: to buy fresh food for sale

loans.name: Oretha

texts.en:
Oretha is a 37-year-old business woman from Liberia.  She is unmarried and has five children, between 3 and 19.  Only four of her children are currently attending school and they all live at home.  She was unfortunate to not attend school.  She describes herself as a hardworking woman.
She lives and works in Buchanan, the capital City of Grand Bassa County and is located by the sea. It is well known for its beaches and delicious fish.  Many logging companies are also based in the city. Residents of the city love eating fufu, cassava based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce.  Most people in the city are Bassa speakers, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia. 
Oretha has a stable business where she sells freezer fish, chicken and pig feet for the past three years.  She works from 8am to 4pm everyday at her business. Her greatest challenge in business is less income. She intends to use the loan to buy more freezer fish, chicken and pig feet. She started her business by selling for her mother. She likes her business because it helps to support her home. She hopes to one day own a house. She wants to thank the Kiva lenders in advance for their help.

loans.use: to buy more freezer fish, chicken, and pig feet.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is Liberian. She resides in Buchanan, the capital City of Grand Bassa County. The county is located by the sea and is known for their beaches and fish. In addition, many logging companies are also located in the city.  eople in Buchanan are known in the country for their love of fufu, a cassava based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce. 

She is 30, single with two children aged 3 and 9, who are currently living at home and attending school.  

Emma has a shop which sells used clothes for over nine years now. She will use the loan to buy more used clothes for her business.  

On average, she works eight hours per day at her business from Monday to Saturday. She started her business with a small amount of money from her fiancee. She transports her merchandise by taxi. She cites fewer goods in her shop as her biggest challenge. She enjoy the profit making of the business. In the future, she would like to one day own a house. 
 
She is grateful for your support!

loans.use: to buy more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Zapharan

texts.en:
Zapharan, 32, is a resident of Nansana, a suburb of Kampala. She is married with 3 children; all of them attend school. Zapharan sells general merchandise, a business that she started in 2010 on a busy street with the aim of improving on her daily income. Her major challenges in the business are inadequate capital and competition in the market.

Zapharan wants a loan of 1,500,000 UGX to buy more goods from the town to stock her business so that she can meet the growing demand of her customers, which is speculated to be high.

She normally serves the passersby and neighbors along the street, but she has business with various restaurants, too. 

She is hardworking, determined and always focuses on her business in order to have a better business in future.

loans.use: to buy cups, plates, and other items to sell at retail prices.

loans.name: Yassah

texts.en:
Yassah is 33 years old. She lives and works in Buchanan, the capital City of Grand Bassa County, which is located by the sea.  It is well known for its beaches and delicious fish.  Many logging companies are also based in the city.  Residents of the city love eating fufu, cassava based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce.  

Most people in the city are Bassa speakers, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia. She is married. She completed grade 12 and has three children between 2 and 7 years old. Only one is in school, and they live at home. For the past 8 years she has been selling pepper, bitter ball, oil, vita, etc. She started her business with money from her husband, and she learned trading from her mother. She likes that the customers buy when she sells. She spends 9 hours per day on her business from Monday to Saturday. She is requesting a loan to purchase more pepper, bitter ball, oil, vita, etc for her business. She hopes to move from a table business to a shop.

loans.use: to purchase more pepper, bitter ball, oil, vita, etc for her business

loans.name: Kpannah

texts.en:
Kpannah is 37 years old, and she lives and works in Buchanan, the capital City of Grand Bassa County, which is located by the sea. It is well known for its beaches and delicious fish. Many logging companies are also based in the city. Residents of the city love eating fufu, cassava based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce.

Kpannah is married and has three children ages 6 and 14, all of whom are in school and live at home. She finished 12th grade. For the past 7 years, she been selling table market items, such as oil, onion, soap, pepper and salt. She started this business with the sum of one thousand Liberian dollars that she lent from her mother. Some problems she is facing include less commodities. She is requesting a loan to purchase oil, onion, soap, pepper and salt for her business. She likes her business because it helps her to save. Her plan is to build her house and become a big businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase oil, onion, soap, pepper, salt for her business

loans.name: Eterno Amanecer Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ETERNO AMANECER” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Olga es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de papa, venta de juguetes, artesanía en vicuñas, venta de fruta, venta de verduras, venta de cofites.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Olga es integrante, ella indica que es el segundo ciclo que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que anteriormente ella ayudaba a su madre en la misma actividad posteriormente decide implementar su propio espacio de trabajo.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de arroz por quintal) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para su familia ya que ella es soltera y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gustan las capacitaciones y el comportamiento.

Al grupo acompaña a la Asesora, ella esta vestida con saco blanco y cafe.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Eterno Amanecer” (Eternal Dawn) is starting its second loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Panamericana Community Center.  This group consists of eight members and is led by a Board of Directors in which Sra. Olga serves as the secretary.  The members of this Communal Bank engage in various businesses such as selling food, selling potatoes, selling toys, selling vicuñas, selling fruit, selling vegetables, and selling candy.  

This loan will benefit small entrepreneurs such as Sra. Olga.  She says that this is her second cycle since joining Pro Mujer after receiving an invitation from a promoter of the organization who visited her at her house.  Olga currently has a business of selling food.  She became knowledgeable in this trade by helping her mother with this same type of work.  Eventually she decided to start her own business.  

The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital for buying rice by the quintal (1 quintal = 46 kg).  She acquires her supplies at the fairs in the city of El Alto and then prepares the food that she sells at her retail space.  Working in this manner enables her to generate income for her family.  Olga is single and has two children.  

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Olga said that she enjoys the training classes and the way the organization conducts itself.  

The group pictured includes their loan officer, the woman in the brown and white coat.

loans.use: to buy rice in bulk.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is aged 48 years old. He is married with 6 children, five of whom attend school and he is in charge for payment of their school fees. He is a farmer, mainly growing sugarcane, banana, coffee and pineapples for both commercial and home consumption. Stephen gets additional income from cattle rearing. Stephen has approached Ugafode for a loan of UGX 2,000,000 to complete the construction of his house. He intends to buy iron sheets, doors, windows and paying workers to give his family better accomodation. Stephen says he will be able to pay back the loan in smaller installment using proceeds from the sale of banana and pineapples. Stephen faces the challenge of weather which is unreliable and affects his agricultural projects at times. His dream is to complete his house and to buy a tractor to ease his agricultural projects.

loans.use: to buy iron sheets, doors and windows

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es: El Sr. Tomas tiene 37 años, tiene tres hijos de las edades de 7, 5 y 3 años,  el se dedica a la agricultura sembrando variedad de vegetales como también papa y yuca y maíz en su parcela que se encuentra en la comunidad de Villa Esperanza,  este préstamo es el su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  el Sr. Tomas va a utilizar  este préstamo para la siembra de yuca   y lo que implica el preparado de la tierra para la siembra, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es para obtener recursos  para la siembra y poder subsistir, el Sr. Tomas enfrenta retos en su negocio que son las inclemencias del clima que en muchas ocasiones arruinan los sembradíos,  y utilizara los beneficios para mejorara la calidad de vida del cliente y de su familia ya que el corre con todos los gastos del hogar, es una persona  responsable y trabajadora se siente agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado, una vez que cosecha sus productos los comercializa en el mercado de la comunidad directamente del productor al consumidor.
texts.en:
Tomas, 37, has three children ages 7, 5 and 3.  He is a crop farmer and grows a variety of vegetables, such as potatoes, yucca and corn on his land which is in the community of Villa Esperanza.  This loan is his first through the institution.  Tomas plans to use the loan to prepare his land and to plant yucca.  

The reason he is requesting a loan is to cover planting costs and also have enough money to live on.  The challenge Tomas faces is the bad weather affecting his crop which sometimes gets ruined.  He plans to use the profits to improve his and his family's lifestyle, since he is the one responsible for covering all the household expenses.  He is a responsible, hard-working person who is grateful for the support received from the institution.

At harvest time he will sell his produce at the community market, directly from producer to consumer.

loans.use: To prepare the land and plant yucca.

loans.name: Dúo Solidario Luchando Por Nuestros Sueños Group

texts.es:
Duo Solidario luchando por nuestos sueños.
Este grupo esta a cargo de la señorita Evelyn Carolina quien tiene 31 años de edad, y se dedica a la venta de variedades en general, como los peluches en diferentes tamaños, fantasía en general como anillos, pulseras , aretes todo elaborado por ella, también vende lo que es plástico como vasos, platos, cubetas y alcanzillas infantiles en plástico.  Tiene este negocio desde hace muchos años y se aproxima la feria del lugar la cual ella no tiene muchos juguetes y desea comprar por docena para poder vender en esta fecha única del año.  Para la compra de los juguetes y fantasía necesita invertir mucho lo cual por ese motivo hace solicitud de otro crédito para no dejar de aprovechar la feria y así seguir creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
Dúo Solidario Luchando por Nuestros Sueños Group

This group is directed by Evelyn Carolina, 31, who sells a variety of merchandise in general, such as different stuffed animals, costume jewelry (rings, bracelets and earrings) which she makes, and plastic cups, plates, and children's toys.   She has had the business for many years.  

The local fair is fast approaching and Evelyn Carolina does not have many toys to sell.  She wants to buy them by the dozen to sell at this unique time of year.  In order to buy toys and jewelry materials she needs to invest quite a bit of money.  Therefore, she is requesting a loan so as not to lose out on this opportunity to grow her business.

loans.use: To buy plastic goods to sell.

loans.name: Kumba

texts.en:
Kumba is 30 years old. She lives and works in Buchanan, the capital city of Grand Bassa County and is located by the sea.  It is well known for its beaches and delicious fish.  Many logging companies are also based in the city.  Residents of the city love eating fufu, a cassava based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce.  Most people in the city are Bassa speakers, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia. 

Kumba and her fiancée live together. She stopped her education in 5th grade and has five children between 11 and 2 years old, only three of whom are in school, and they all live at home.  For the past four years Kumba has been selling used clothes in the local market. She started this business by selling for her mother, and she learned this business from her friends. She likes the profit she makes from her business. Kumba is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business, and hopes to have more money to sustain her family.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase an 8 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase an 8 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en: Ligaya is married and lives in San Juan, Pana-on, Misamis Occidental with her family. Her husband is a farmer; she sells the produce of their farm in the market to earn a living. She also buys farm products in their community and resells them for additional income. She received a loan from Gata Daku MPC micro credit to purchase additional fruits and vegetables for resale. She plans to use her generated income as additional capital for her business expansion.

loans.use: to purchase additional fruits and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Maria Adriana

texts.es:
María es una joven de 21 años de edad, ama de casa y agricultora, madre de un hijo el cual tiene una edad de 5 años y en casa viven solo ellos como familia. Ella tiene un nivel de educación primaria completo cursado gracias al apoyo financiero por parte de sus padres mismos que le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra desde muy temprana edad siendo esta actividad una tradición en su familia. Ella en compañía de su pareja de dedican a la siembra y cultivo de café siendo sus clientes los vecinos y amigos compradores en la zona. El terreno que juntos trabajan está ubicado en la misma zona donde ella habita teniendo muchas felicidades para su mantenimiento, cuidado y asistencia. Su mayor desafío para cada temporada es poder cosechar y cultivar plantas de calidad sacando un producto al final de la cosecha de calidad y mejor cada día.

Ella y su pareja se esmeran mucho por brindarles el mejor servicio y producto a sus clientes ya que gracias a ello pueden atraer más personas para la compra de su producto. Es por eso que ella ha solicitado un financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL para la compra de insumos agrícola que ayuden a sus cultivos a mantenerse con un buen follaje y un buen grano.  

Sus planes a futuro son los de mejorar la calidad de sus cultivos sembrando nueva chapola con calidad como el borbón, caturra que es un poco más caro pero de mejor calidad de esa forma ella podrá percibir más ingresos y darle un nivel de educación a su hijo y un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
María, 21, is a homemaker and farmer.  She has a five-year-old son and the two of them live alone.  She received a full elementary education thanks to financial support from her parents who also taught her from a very young age to work on the farm as it was the family tradition.  María and her partner plant and grow coffee and sell to neighbors and friends in the area.  The land they work on is in the same area where she lives so maintenance, care and assistance is easier.  The main challenge every season is to cultivate and harvest a quality crop by making it better each day.

María and her partner work hard to offer the best possible product and service to customers, because this allows them to attract more people to buy their product.  This is why she is requesting a loan through the COMIXMUL institution.  She will use it to buy farm supplies that will help maintain a good leafy crop and a good coffee bean.

Her future plans include improving the quality of her crop by planting new varieties such as borbón and caturra which are a little more expensive but better quality.  This will allow her to earn more income so she can give her son an education and better lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies for her coffee crop.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 43 years old. She lives and works in Buchanan, the capital City of Grand Bassa County, and is located by the sea.  It is well known for its beaches and delicious fish.  Many logging companies are also based in the city.  Residents of the city love eating fufu, a cassava based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce.  Most people in the city are Bassa speakers, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia. 

Grace is married. She completed grade 9 and has three children between the ages of 4 and 26, only one of whom is in school and lives at home. For the past 11 years, Grace has been selling flour. She started this business with money from her husband, and she learned this business from her friends. She likes how fast her goods are sold from her table. She spends 10 hours with her business six days a week. Grace is requesting a loan to purchase flour by the bag for her business. She would like to own a house in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase flour by the bag for her business.

loans.name: Augusta Balbina

texts.es:
Augusta continua con la elaboración de panes y le va excelente, Augusta agradece infinitamente a todos los inversionistas que le apoyaron con el préstamo anterior pues le ayudo con el capital del negocio entonces en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar harina, azúcar, manteca, mantequilla, colorantes, saborizantes, y otras cosas más.  

Augusta vive en la ciudad de Challabamba. (El distrito de Challabamba está ubicado en la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco, Perú). Ella tiene 27 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos.
texts.en:
Augusta continues with her bread making business which is going extremely well.  She is very grateful to all the lenders who supported her through the previous loan as it helped increase her working capital.  On this occasion, she is requesting a loan to buy flour, sugar, lard, butter, food coloring, flavorings and other things.

Augusta lives in the city of Challabamba.  (The district of Challabamba is located in the province of Paucartambo, in the department of Cusco, Perú).  She is 27 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has two children.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, lard, butter, food coloring, flavorings, and other things.

loans.name: Mechelyn

texts.en:
Mechelyn lives in the village of Palilan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 46 years old and is married. To earn a living, she has been selling fish in the market for more than ten years, earning about 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2005, Mechelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and her ability to engage in business. Recently, she requested a loan of 13,000 PHP to buy more fish to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by this loan to continue expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is a 64-year-old widow residing in Rizal, Jimenez. She provides her five children's needs from income generated from her own piggery business. She earns 4,000 PHP monthly from her piggery business, which she has operated for more than 12 years. 

Aside from raising pigs, she is also engaged in manufacturing nipa to sell in the community. In 2008 she became a member of GDMPC, and recently she applied for a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy more nipa leaves (from the nipa palm, often used for thatching) to weave. Divina wants to expand her business and use the generated income to repair their house.

loans.use: to buy more nipa leaves to weave.

loans.name: Khayal

texts.en:
Khayal is 31 years old, married, the father of 4-year-old kid and a veteran of the war. After an injury he received in the war, he had some difficulties with employment. After his marriage, he decided to become a taxi driver to financially support his family. During this time he was even able to sell his old car and buy a new one.

The house in which he lives was inherited from his parents, but it needs major repairs. He has a little child and his wife is pregnant with the second, so he has to improve the living conditions at home. Khayal needs 1,000 AZN manats to purchase construction materials.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Gankhuyag

texts.en:
Mr. Gankhuyag, 30 years old, lives with his wife and children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Two years ago he purchased a plot of land from his brother and built his own house there. 

He has been transporting goods between cities. Before this business, he had worked as distribution manager at an ice cream factory. Currently his wife is unemployed and stays at home looking after the children. 

The house Gankhuyag built two years ago is losing its heat through door parts, so he is planning to make an extension to the house by building a barn. For this, he is requesting a loan of 3,500,000 MNT to purchase building materials such as planks, bricks and cement. By doing so, he will effectively stop the heat loss from the house. As a result, his family will reduce its coal consumption, release fewer pollutants and contribute to the efforts against air pollution.

loans.use: to make an extension to his house.

loans.name: Eldemilia

texts.en:
Eldemilia is from Corrales, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 45 years old, married, and has three children. To make a living, she owns and operates a tricycle transportation and rental service. She has been in business for more than five years and earns 10,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2006, Eldemilia joined GDMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, to be used for maintenance costs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance of her tricycles

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is a 51-year-old married woman from Getafe, Bohol. She has 5 children. She runs a retail store. She sells items ranging from cooking oil, sugar, soaps, shampoos and soft drinks to noodles. She has been operating a retail store for almost 7 years.

She requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy more stock like dry goods, rice pollard (pig feed), and fertilizers, to attract more customers and maintain her store inventory. In the future, Lucia would like to expand her retail store business to improve her livelihood status.

loans.use: to buy more stock like dry goods, rice pollard (pig feed), and fertilizers.
