His most recent loan from Babban Gona provided him with enough fertilizer to optimize his yields and access to a product that eliminates a food toxin in his maize, enabling his family to eat healthier maize and for him to get a premium price for the maize he sells.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seed that will double his yield and income

loans.name: Danzaria

texts.en: Danzaria is a dedicated maize farmer and member of Babban Gona.  Before joining Babban Gona, his yields were minimal as he did not have access to high quality inputs like improved seeds.  He often purchased seeds with low viability from the open market and low quality fertilizers.  Like all Babban Gona members, he now has access to high quality farm inputs like improved seeds and fertilizer, and also premium markets for his maize product.  He can expect to earn $1,350/ha this season, double the income of an average Nigerian farmer.  With his increased earnings, he hopes to improve the lives of his family.  His most recent loan from Babban Gona provided him with enough fertilizer to optimize his yields and access a product that eliminates a food toxin in his maize, enabling his family to eat healthier maize and for him to get a premium price for the maize he sells.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seed that will double his yield and income

loans.name: Yahuza

texts.en: Yahuza is a 25-year-old farmer from Pampaida Dutse.  As a Babban Gona member, he is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist.  Like all Babban Gona members, he can earn up to $1,350/ha this season from his maize farm, double the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  He plans to expand his farming business speedily with his increased earnings.  With this loan, Yahuza is on his way to achieving these dreams.  His most recent loan from Babban Gona provided him with enough fertilizer to optimize his yields and access a product that eliminates a food toxin in his maize, enabling his family to eat healthier maize and for him to get a premium price for the maize he sells.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seed that will double his yields and income

loans.name: Nara's Group

texts.en: Nara, a mother of two schoolchildren and one other child, is an inhabitant of Battambang province. Her two hectares of paddy rice farmland, with the support of her husband, is her single business in which she has engaged for ages. It has earned her about 24,000 KHR per day. Nara has never been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before. She formed a group of two to apply for a new loan of 400,000 KHR each. As the leader, Nara will spend her loan portion to buy rice seed and herbicide for her paddy field. She hopes this purchase will triple her yield and make her a good profit.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and herbicide for her paddy field

loans.name: Nuhu

texts.en: Nuhu is a dedicated farmer and member of Babban Gona from Chino village in Kaduna.  Like all Babban Gona members, he can expect to earn up to $1,350/ha from his maize farm this season, double the average Nigerian farmer’s yearly income.  He looks forward to improving his family’s standard of living.  With this loan, he is on his way to achieving his dreams.  His most recent loan from Babban Gona provided him with enough fertilizer to optimize his yields and access to a product that eliminates a food toxin in his maize, enabling his family to eat healthier maize and for him to get a premium price for the maize he sells.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seed that will double his yield and income

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is a 64-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has two grown children. She does farming, and grows and sells rice to earn a living. She has been growing rice for more than ten years.

To sustain her farming activity back to a normal operation, Imelda requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy fertilizers, pesticides and more rice seedlings. 

In the future, Imelda hopes to have a bountiful harvest and be able to set aside some of the profits to save for the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides and more rice seedlings.

loans.name: Marte

texts.en:
Marte is seeking lenders’ financial help to build some pillars for her vineyard; the amount she needs is 200,000 Albanian Lek. This will be her first loan.

Marte is a 57-year-old villager, and together with her four children and husband, lives in rural northeastern Albania. She has been practicing her agricultural skills to earn an income for almost the past nine years. She sells fresh produce in the nearby market and she considers herself lucky to have her children help her out as well. 

“It’s so much easier having your family members help you out. Agriculture requires hard and physical labour, so help from others is mandatory and much appreciated, also,” she said, smiling at her children.

loans.use: to build some pillars for her vineyards.

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mao, a villager from Sa Ang district of Kandal province, is 34 years old and a mother of four children in school. For her family’s sake, she sells grocery items at home, while her husband grows mangos and beans. This is the business that she has had for ages.

Mao is a fourth-time borrower with Kiva’s partner VisionFund. Her previous loans have helped her to sustain her living and enabled her to buy a decent motorbike to support her farmland. Now, she is requesting a new loan to buy more grocery items for resale including soap, canned food, instant noodles, etc. Additionally, she will spend another portion of her loan to buy potash and insecticide for her crops.

Mao hopes to make a good income so as she can educate her children beyond high school.

loans.use: To buy potash and insecticide for her crops

loans.name: Jesson

texts.en:
Jesson is a 29-year-old married man from Talibon, Bohol. He has 2 children ages 3 and 11 months old respectively.

He operates a motorcycle transport service. He transports passengers from one place to another with a corresponding fee. To have a hassle-free ride, Jesson requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy fuel and for other maintenance to serve his passengers with the best ride. In the future, Jesson would like to invest in other businesses to augment his income and support his growing children.

loans.use: to buy fuel and for other maintenance

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a 33-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She is a mother of four. The oldest child is eight years old, while the youngest is seven months old. 

Teresita raises and sells hogs as her main livelihood. She has been raising hogs for almost one year. Her husband works at a gasoline station. To help sustain her business, Teresita requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy feed like pellets. This will help the pigs grow fast and healthy so she can sell them on time. 

In the future, Teresita would like to invest in other ventures to help meet the family's daily expenses and also send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed like pellets

loans.name: Verónica  Petrona

texts.es: La señora Verónica es originaria de una comarca del poblado , de profesión maestra de primaria y está ubicada  en un colegio de la comunidad, tiene 13 años de impartir clases, su núcleo familiar  consta de 2 personas que son su hijo,  y su esposo, esta señora solicito financiamiento para terminar el pago de un lote de terreno, por tal razón visito las oficinas de ceprodel para ser beneficiada y de esa manera mejorar sus condiciones y nivel de vida, lo que le dara satisfacción de brindarle a su familia principalmente a sus  hijos , que es por quien    se esfuerza cada día para darle lo  mejor.
texts.en: Verónica is originally from a region in town. She's a primary school teacher and works in a school in the community. She has been a teacher for 13 years. Her nuclear family comprises 2 people: her son and her husband. She is requesting a loan to finish payment on a parcel of land. She visited the Ceprodel office in order to request this loan as a way to improve her family's conditions and quality of life, especially her children, which would bring her great satisfaction, as they are the reason she makes an effort every day.

loans.use: finish payment on a parcel of land.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph lives in the Ndaragwa area of Kenya, which has one of the cooler climates in Kenya. He has no children and has been farming for 10 years. His primary income sources are milk, eggs, crops, and transportation services.
Joseph stated what is most enjoyable about farming: “Selling the produce.” His biggest challenge is “Watering crops.” Animals on the farm have been given no names.
Joseph was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: “Their good services.” Joseph was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: “They give small loans to farmers to acquire assets.”
Joseph’s highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked how this loan will benefit his family, Joseph replied, “More income will improve the livelihood.”
As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower’s assets are evaluated. Joseph owns the following: a cow, poultry, and motorcycle, but does not own a pig, pump, bicycle, or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. Joseph’s household has electricity, running water, TV, and DVD, but does not have a mosquito net, solar power, or sewing machine.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy medical supplies

loans.name: Yashar

texts.en:
Yashar, a 47-year-old married father of a 25-year-old son, has 20 years of experience as a master of auto repair. He also sells auto spare parts and is engaged in welding operations. He has earned the respect of the village thanks to the quality and integrity of his work. Previous loans from VFAC helped him develop his business, and in the future he plans to expand the service.

Yashar's son is getting married, and according to tradition the groom's family gives gold items to the bride as weddings gifts. For this purpose Yashar has requested a loan of 1000 AZN manats. He thanks all and wishes you health and the desire and ability to perform noble deeds

loans.use: To buy gold items for his son's wedding.

loans.name: Fany Xiomara

texts.es:
Fany es una joven emprendedora, luchadora con deseos de superase salir adelante y ser un ejemplo para sus 2 hijos de los cuales ninguno de ellos estudia ya que están pequeños. Ella tiene una edad de 25 años y 11 años de educación los cuales pudo cursar con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio. Su negocio es una pulpería la cual decidió emprender como un negocio formal hace 4 meses identificando una necesidad en la zona donde ella habita ya que no había ninguna pulpería en la zona. Sus clientes son sus vecinos, familiares y amigos que la visitan para poder adquirir productos para el consumo en sus hogares como arroz, frijoles, jugos de caja, huevos, frescos de botella desechable y vidrio, etc. que son de consumo diario. Su negocio está ubicado en su misma casa de habitación por la cual es una gran ventaja ya que paga un solo alquiler y tiene mejores ingresos para su familia.

Mediante la demanda que ella tiene en su negocio ella ha solicitado un financiamiento en la cooperativa COMIXMUL para poder comprar producto en mayor cantidad así tendrá más surtido su negocio saciando necesidades que hoy en día no está cubriendo.

Sus planes son poder hacer crecer su negocio convertirlo paso a paso en un pequeño supermercado con el cual pueda abastecer muchas más necesidades para que así genere ingresos muchos y empleo a personas. Su sueño es hacer algún día su casa con la cual pueda darles un techo a sus hijos y su familia en general la cual sea de manera propia.
texts.en:
Fanny is an enterprising young woman, a fighter with the desire to get ahead and be an example for her 2 children, neither of whom study because they are too young. She is 25 years old and she has had 11 years of education whereby she studied with a lot of effort and sacrifice. 

Her business is a grocery store which she decided to set-up as a formal business 4 months ago, identifying a need in the area where she lives because there wasn't a grocery store there. Her customers are her neighbors, relatives and friends that visit her so they can buy products to consume at home like rice, beans, juice boxes, eggs, soft drinks in disposable and glass bottles, etc that are for daily consumption. 

Her business is located in her home, which is a great advantage because she only pays one rent and has a better income for her family. Because of the business' demand she has applied for financing in the COMIXMUL cooperative so she can buy product in larger quantities and therefore she will have more stock in her business to fill needs that are currently not being filled. 

Her plans are to be able to grow her business to convert it step by step into a small supermarket where she will be able to supply many more necessities in order to generate a lot of income and employment for people. Her dream is to one day build her house so she can give a roof to her children and their family in general in her own way.

loans.use: to buy products to stock her grocery store business.

loans.name: Enhsaihan

texts.en:
Ms. Enhsaihan is 25 years old and lives with her brother and parents in the Bayanzurh district of Ulaanbaatar. Currently she is studying for a masters degree at the National University of Mongolia. She is so passionate about different and old languages and this has driven her to choose linguistics as her major.

After she graduates from her university, she will be able to get a job which pays a salary of around a million MNT, thus she will provide financial support for her family.

She is now requesting a loan of 1,112,500 MNT to pay her tuition fee to obtain good knowledge to invest in her future as well as her family.

loans.use: to pay tuition fee

loans.name: Lilivit

texts.en:
Lilivit is a 48-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has 9 children: the oldest is 17 while the youngest is 3.

She raises hogs. She raises and sells hogs as a source of her livelihood.  She has been raising hogs for almost 10 years. Her husband works as an electrical technician.

Due to lack of capital, she requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy additional pigs and feeds to increase the number of pigs and also increase sales. In the future, Lilivit would like to expand her business to provide her children with the best.

loans.use: to buy additional pigs and feeds

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a hardworking woman who operates a vegetable stall. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of establishing a grocery store in the future.

With the KES 10,000 she wants to purchase stock of green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes and onions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes and onions

loans.name: Robin Yobani

texts.es:
Robin tiene 33 años de edad,tiene estudio hasta bachillerato, su compañera de vida se dedica a hacer arreglos de sastrería (confección), tiene un hijo de 7 años, que se encuentra estudiando actualmente. 
Cuando Robin,  logro terminar su bachillerato técnico en mecanica automotriz, luego ya no pudo seguir preparandose por falta de recursos económicos. Por la situición que hay en el país de desempleo; no ha podido ejercer sus conocimientos en mécanica. Pero gracias a su tío, que le enseño  el oficio de albañileria , hoy trabaja como ayudante en trabajos que consigue su tío. Trabajan donde haya la oportunidad sea cerca o lejos de su casa. Su horario es de 8 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde.  Robin gana  $6 dólares el día de trabajo. 

El prestamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 400 ladrillos, 3 bolsas de cemento, 2 quintales de hierro y 2 metros cúbicos de arena.  Lo requiere para la mejora de su  vivienda que esta construyendo poco a poco por no poseer los recursos  suficientes. Al terminarla, podrá tener  en mejores condiciones  su vivienda y su familia tendrá tranquilidad y seguridad ante las lluvias y la inseguridad del país. 
Don Robin, desea ejercer su profesión de mecánico automotriz , estableciendo su propio negocio , pudiendo así tener mejores ingresos para su familia y darle los estudios a su hijo.
texts.en:
Robin is 33 years old. He studied until receiving his college diploma. His life partner makes a living through tailoring repairs (dressmaking). He has one child who is 7 years old, who currently is studying.

When Robin was able to finish his technical degree in automotive mechanics, he was not able to continue preparing himself at that time because of a lack of economic resources. Because of the unemployment situation of the country, he has not been able to practice his mechanical knowledge. However, thanks to his uncle who taught him the construction trade, he now works as an assistant on jobs that his uncle obtains. They work where there is an opportunity, whether it is close or far from his home. His schedule is from 8 in the morning until 5 in the evening. Robin makes 6 dollars per day of work.

The loan that he is requesting from Fundación Campo is to buy 400 bricks, 3 bags of cement, 2 hundredweights of iron, and 2 cubic meters of sand. He wants it to improve his home that he is building little by little since he does not possess sufficient resources. When finished, he will be able to have his home in better condition and his family will have tranquility and security from the rains and the country’s insecurity.

Robin wishes to practice his profession of automotive mechanics, establishing his own business and therefore being able to have a better income for his family and to pay for his child’s studies.

loans.use: to buy 400 bricks, 3 bags of cement, 2 hundredweights of iron, and 2 cubic meters of sand.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a 24-year-old single man living in the capital city of Tbilisi with his parents. George is unemployed at the moment and the only source for the family is the small income earned by George’s father working as a furniture manufacturer.

George owns a car and plans to use it as a taxi and start a business, but it is out of order and now he is requesting credit to fix the car. His request was approved in the framework of the Start Up program, which is a joint initiative of Kiva and MFO, permitting the vulnerable poor to start or re-start businesses.

A loan of $1,000 will help George to pay for the repair of his car and change his car's fuel system from benzene to gas, which is cheaper than benzene and will reduce the cost of transportation by 40 to 45 per cent. It will allow George to offer cheap service to his customers. With this Startup loan, George will start a taxi business and help the family in covering food and everyday expenses. The increased income will be used for his family's well being.

loans.use: to repair his car and change the fuel system

loans.name: Sabir

texts.en:
Sabir has been breeding bees for honey, beeswax and other products, as well as for the pollination of crops in order to increase their productivity. He has been in this business for more 16 years. He needs to buy crates for bees, so he applied for a loan of 1,200 AZN.

Sabir is married and has three children ages 19, 17 and 15. He works as a teacher of mathematics and private tutor by profession.

loans.use: To buy crates for bees.

loans.name: Dalia Sonia

texts.es: Dalia, trabaja en una empresa textilera como vendedora devengando un salario mínimo, con el que se ayuda para mantener sus estudios de Ing. en Sistemas, siendo su mayor sueño terminar sus estudios y encontrar un empleo acorde a su profesión. La joven solicita el crédito para la compra una computadora, para ir preparándose aun más, adquiriendo experiencia con esta herramienta que es de vital importancia para su buen desarrollo profesional.
texts.en:
Dalia works as a sales person in a textile company. She earns a minimum wage, which she uses to support her Systems Engineering studies. Her greatest dream is to complete her studies and find a job related to her profession. 

She is requesting this loan to buy a computer for study purposes. She would like to gain more experience with computers, as this will be essential for her professional development.

loans.use: to buy a computer

loans.name: Tabriz

texts.en:
Tabriz is 21 years old and the head of the family. He lives with his pensioner mother and dreams about his own family.  A year ago, he started his own business, renting tents, utensils, tables, and chairs for the mourning ceremonies and together with two assistants delivers treats. 

Tabriz is requesting a loan for 2,000 AZN, which he will use to buy new tables and chairs.

loans.use: to purchase tables and chairs for mourning ceremonies.

loans.name: El Grupo Activo Group

texts.es:
“EL GRUPÓ ACTIVO” es una alcancía recién formada, lo conforman 10 socias muy entusiastas. Gladys es una de ellas se integro al grupo invitada por  una amiga, ella es casada y tiene 02 hijos pequeños. Gladys tiene una librería bazar empezó este negocio para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, su librería está ubicada en su misma casa, así  trabaja sin descuidar a sus hijos. Gladys se siente feliz porque gracias a su trabajo sus hijos pueden tener una mejor educación, su negocio tiene mucha acogida porque está cerca de un colegio estatal, por lo tanto las ventas son buenas, sobretodo la venta de útiles escolares, el préstamo que ha solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de útiles de escritorio como cuadernos, papelería y otros artículos educativos, gracias a su préstamo podrá mejorar su negocio y seguir creciendo.
Gladys agradece por la confianza al otorgarle este crédito, en la foto es la 6ta de la izquierda viste chaleco azul y blusa floreada.
texts.en:
“El Grupo Activo” is a recently-formed bank. It is made up of 10 very enthusiastic members. Gladys is one of them. She joined the group through the invitation from a friend. She is married and has two small children. 

Gladys has a bookstore and stationery shop. She started this business to support her husband with the home expenses. Her bookstore is located in her own home so that she can work without neglecting her children. Gladys is happy because, thanks to her work, her children can have a better education. Her business has had a good reception because it is close to a state school. Because of this, her sales are good, above all the sale of school supplies.

She will invest the loan that she has requested in the purchase of office supplies like notebooks, paper, and other educational items. Thanks to her loan she will be able to improve her business and continue growing.

Gladys is thankful for the confidence shown in awarding her this loan. In the photo, she is the sixth from the left, dressed in a blue vest and flower-print shirt.

loans.use: to buy office supplies.

loans.name: Martina

texts.es:
Martina continua con la agricultura, con la ganadería y con la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes y gallinas y le va excelente, ella agradece infinitamente a todos los inversionistas que le apoyaron con el préstamo anterior pues le ayudo con el capital del negocio entonces en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar animales menores como cuyes y gallinas. 

Martina nació en la comunidad de Cuyo Grande (Pisaq, Cusco, Perú) pero vive en la comunidad de Jajahuana. (La comunidad de Jajahuana está ubicado en el distrito de Challabamba dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco, Perú). Ella tiene 36 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene seis hijos.
texts.en:
Martina continues with agriculture, animal husbandry and small livestock rearing such as guinea pigs and chickens and it is going very well.  She is indebted to all the investors who supported the previous loan; it helped her with the business capital.  Now this opportunity requires a loan to purchase [additional] small animals such as guinea pigs and chickens.  

Martina was born in the community of Cuyo Grande (which is in Pisaq, Cusco, Pero), but now lives in the community of Jajahuana.  (The community of Jajahuana is located in the District of Challabamba in Paucartambo Province, Department of Cusco, Peru.)  She is 36 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has six children.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Liceth Del Florón  (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
En  el sector conocido como El Florón en la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen cada quince días las 9 socias y los 2 socios del Banco Comunal Liceth del Florón. Las mismas que se dedican a diversas actividades tales como el comercio en general, la prestación de  servicios entre otras cosas. Hace tiempo atrás decidieron unirse y formar este grupo de crédito el cual les ha ayudado mucho en sus negocios y su vida familiar.

El socio de este grupo es el señor Limbert, tiene 46 años de edad está casado y de esta relación tiene tres hijos de 24, 20 y 15  años, el menor  estudia en colegio. Su esposa es ama de casa y le ayuda en su negocio.

Don Limber es oriundo del cantón Santa Ana pero desde hace mas de 20 años que se mudo a esta ciudad e hizo su vida familiar aquí, él desde que llego tuvo la idea de poner su propio negocio y es así como con lo que tenia surtió una pequeña tienda de víveres la misma que ha ido mejorando con el paso del tiempo, actualmente a mas de víveres también vende carne, frutas, legumbres, pescado, aguas gaseosas y gas de uso domestico para lo cual tiene una bodega aparte.  Este negocio le ha dado para sacar adelante a su familia e ir mejorando su calidad de vida día a día y ahora mas con la ayuda de los créditos.

Este crédito es para comprar víveres para surtir su tienda. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan a todo el grupo. 

Sus sueños son seguir adelante y gozar de buena salud.
texts.en:
In the area known as “El Florón” (the rosette) in the city of Portoviejo there is a reunion every 15 days of the 9 female members and 2 male members of the “Liceth del Florón” Community Bank. They work in various activities such as trade in general, service delivery and more. Some time ago they decided to unite and form this group of community bank which has helped them a lot in their business and family life.

A member of this group is Mr. Limbert who is 46-years-old, is married, and has three children who are 24, 20 and 15 years old.  The youngest is student in college. His wife is a homemaker and helps him with his business.

Limber is a native of Cantón Santa Ana, but more than 20 years ago he moved to this city and started his family life here. Since then he had the idea of starting his own business and this is how it has grown.  He had one small grocery store and has been improving it over time.  Currently, he also sells other items of food such as meat, fruits, vegetables, fish, sparkling water and gas for domestic use, which has a separate location. 

This business has given him the ability to get his family ahead and keep improving their quality of life day by day and now more so with the help of loans. This credit is to buy groceries to stock for his store. He has been a member from the start of the community bank and likes it for the help they give to the whole group. His dreams are to get ahead and enjoy good health.

loans.use: to buy provisions

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret owns a cafe where she makes various foods such as cooked rice, beans, posho and flat bread, selling to her customers who are passersby and neighbors. She cites seasonality as her major challenge.

Margaret, who joined Yehu to access the funds, is requesting a loan of ksh.40,000 to purchase utensils, sacks of beans and rice, wheat flour and sugar for her business.

loans.use: to purchase utensils, sacks of beans and rice, wheat flour and sugar for her business.

loans.name: Rossina

texts.en:
Rossina is a hardworking woman who practices farming; she plants various crops, such as vegetables and tomatoes.

She is requesting a loan of ksh.50,000 to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and farm chemicals for her farm.

She joined Yehu to access the loan funds.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and farm chemicals for her farm

loans.name: Tonny

texts.en:
Tonny, who lives in Mombasa, Kenya, is 31 years old, married and blessed with two children aged eight and six, both of whom attend school. Tonny runs a retail shop in Jomvu area that is doing fine, and he sees himself owning a wholesale business in the next five years. His enterprise has been in operation for more than ten years, and his challenges are high transportation costs and the high cost of goods.

Tonny learnt of Milango through an employee who invited him to join. He now seeks a loan to buy retail stock like sugar, salt and flour. The extra income that he will raise from the business will help improve their living standards.

loans.use: to buy retail stock like sugar, flour etc.

loans.name: Mirna Xiomara

texts.es: Mirna,  tiene 48 años de edad, es soltera,  tiene un hijo y vive con el  en el municipio de Tela, Atlántida.  Ella tiene dos años de dedicarse a la venta de ropa nueva y usada, como blusas, ropa interior y ropa de niños. Anteriormente vendía jugos naturales de frutas. Ha solicitado un préstamo por 2,500 Lempiras para comprar ropa nueva para la venta. Como blusas y ropa de niño. Su plan personal es mejorar la comunión con Dios, mejorar su negocio para darle un estudio a su hijo.
texts.en:
Mirna,  tiene 48 años de edad, es soltera,  tiene un hijo y vive con el  en el municipio de Tela, Atlántida.  Ella tiene dos años de dedicarse a la venta de ropa nueva y usada, como blusas, ropa interior y ropa de niños. Anteriormente vendía jugos naturales de frutas. Ha solicitado un préstamo por 2,500 Lempiras para comprar ropa nueva para la venta. Como blusas y ropa de niño. Su plan personal es mejorar la comunión con Dios, mejorar su negocio para darle un estudio a su hijo.

Mirna is 48, single, the mother of a son, and lives in the city of Tela, Atlántida. She has for two years sold new and used clothing, such as blouses, underwear, and children's clothing. Mirna previously sold natural fruit juices. She has applied for a loan of 2,500 Lempiras to purchase new clothing for sale, such as blouses and children's clothing. Mirna's personal plan is to improve her relationship with God and grow her business in order to provide an education to her son.

loans.use: To purchase new clothing for sale.

loans.name: Mujeres Virtuosas Group

texts.es:
Este es el grupo Mujeres Virtuosas
Una de sus integrantes es Susan de 20 años. Ella es madre soltera y tiene 02 hijas pequeñas, en la actualidad vive en casa de sus padres. Susan trabaja como personal de limpieza para una empresa, por otro lado  hace un año empezó con la venta de productos de belleza y le va muy bien, este negocio le permite obtener ingresos adicionales para que sus hijas tengan una mejor calidad de vida. Susan desea agrandar su negocio y comprar más productos de belleza, gracias al  préstamo solicitado  podrá lograrlo, para mas adelante quiere tener una tienda grande llena de productos de belleza y ofrecer directamente al público. 
A Susan le gustaría agradecer a los inversores por apoyar a su grupo con este préstamo,en la foto es es la 1ra de la izquierda viste casaca celeste y esta con su hija, en la foto de la derecha aparecen 2 socios la Sra. Gloria Y el Sr. Jhon
.
texts.en:
This is the group “Mujeres Virtuosas “ (Virtuous Women).

One of its members is Susan who is 20 years old. She is a single mother and has 2 small daughters.  Currently, she lives with her parents. Susan works as a cleaner for a company and on the other hand she began a year ago selling beauty products and is she doing very well.  This business allows her to earn additional income for her daughters in order to have a better quality of life. Susan wants to enlarge her business and buy more beauty products. Thanks to the loan requested she will be able to. Eventually she want to have a big store full of beauty products and sell directly to the public.

Susan would like to thank the investors for supporting her group with this loan. In the photo she is the 1st on the left-hand side wearing a blue jacket and is with her daughter. In the photo on the right are 2 partners and Gloria and Jhon.

.

loans.use: to buy beauty products

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a Ugandan, age 35, and married with three children living in Kagadi, Uganda.  

For fourteen years she has been working as a teacher, and with her meager salary, she has been able to pay school fees for her children.  She also has a side business of a retail shop.  Price fluctuation and inadequate capital are her major challenges, while her dream is to have a produce store.

Lydia is requesting a loan to buy maize, beans, and groundnuts to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize, beans, and groundnuts to sell.

loans.name: Gloria Argentina

texts.es: Gloria, tiene 41 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene tres hijas con quienes ella vive en una aldea del municipio de Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara. Hace 3 años tiene una pulpería donde vende productos de la canasta básica como ser manteca, arroz, azúcar, harina, pan, huevos, carnes, refrescos, lácteos, etc. Lleva cuatro ciclos de préstamos con el actual que es por 15,000 lempiras, con esta inversión va surtir de productos alimenticios para el negocio como carnes, refrescos, granos básicos, azúcar, manteca etc. Con el objetivo de comprar por mayor y ganar mas. Su meta es ampliar su negocio y ser una de las pulperías mas surtida de su comunidad.
texts.en:
Gloria is 41 years old.  She is a single mother with three daughters with whom she lives in a village in the municipality of Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara.  She has had a grocery store for three years where she sells basic food products such as butter, rice, sugar, flour, bread, eggs, meat, soft drinks, dairy products, etc.

She will take four cycles of loans; the current one for 15,000 lempiras ($750).  With this investment she will stock food products for the business like meat, soft drinks, basic grains, sugar, butter, etc. with the objective of buying wholesale and earning more.  Her goal is expand her business and to be one of the best stocked markets in her community.

loans.use: to purchase products like butter, meat, basic grains, sugar, etc. to stock her business.

loans.name: Teimuraz

texts.en:
Teimuraz is 61 years old. He is married and lives in the village of Khomuli alone, as his wife works abroad and his daughters are married, living with their families separately.

Teimuraz is involved in an agricultural business. Specifically, he grows maize and nuts on the family-owned land and breeds six calves. In addition, he sells limes and earns a monthly income from this activity.

Teimuraz is very hardworking person, and he wishes to start a dairy farm to generate more income for supporting his daughters.

The loan will be used to purchase two milk cows. Teimuraz will place the cows in the cattle shed located in his yard, and produce cheese with the received milk. The cheese will be sold at the local open market and Teimuraz will get a planned amount of profit. 

He hopes that his wife will be able to return home and live with him.

The couple will tirelessly work in their dairy farm and develop their business gradually.

Teimuraz awaits your generosity.

loans.use: to purchase two dairy cows

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es: Dominga, tiene 45 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 4 hijos y vive en el municipio de Santa Cruz de Yojoa. Ella inicio con una tortillera pero le intereso más este otro negocio de venta de frutas y verduras. Lleva aproximadamente 25 años de trabajar para sostener su hogar. El negocio lo tiene establecido en un puesto de venta a orillas de la carretera. Ha solicitado un préstamo por 6,000 Lempiras con el objetivo de comprar más frutas y verduras como bananos, piña, yuca, elotes, papayas, miel  etc. y mantener variedad de productos que ofrecer a sus clientes. Ella considera que las ventas se incrementaran. Su meta es poder darles el estudio y alimentación a sus hijos.
texts.en: Dominga, is 45-years-old, is a single mother with 4 children, and lives in the town of Santa Cruz de Yojoa. She started with a tortilla making business, but she was more interested in selling fruits and vegetables. She has been working for about 25 years to maintain your home. The business is established in a stall beside the road. She has requested a loan of 6,000 lempiras in order to buy more fruits and vegetables such as bananas, pineapples, cassava, corn, papaya, honey etc. so that she can offer a range of products to her customers. She believes that sales will increase. Her goal is to provide an education and good for her children.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables such as bananas, pineapples, honey, papaya, cassava, etc. to supply the business

loans.name: José Arturo

texts.es:
José tiene 25 años de edad, vive junto a su compañera de vida de 18 años de edad, con quien tiene un hijo de 18 meses de edad. Viven en casa junto a sus papas y dos hermanos más.

Él Se dedica a trabajar como corralero desde hace 10 años, actividad que aprendió al realizarlo con su padre, esta trabajando con un productor ganadero desde hace 8 años. Se encarga de dar el manejo a 60 bovinos con el apoyo de su hermano. En sus tiempos libres con el apoyo de sus familiares cultiva maíz y hortalizas en parcelas de 3,000 metros cuadrados (pipían y ayotes).

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar  una motocicleta. Esta le servirá para transportarse a su lugar de trabajo y dejar de caminar todas las madrugadas hasta 40 minutos en calles balastreadas y obscuras. También, esta planeando salir a vender parte de las cosechas en las comunidades vecinas.


Las Necesidades a satisfacer son la de comodidad y seguridad, además, de facilitarle una herramienta mas con la que pueda obtener otros ingresos al dedicarse a comercializar algunos productos de las cosechas obtenidas.

Él manifiesta que  lo importante y más urgente es: construir una vivienda y vivir en casa diferente de sus padres.
texts.en:
José is 25 years old. He lives with his life companion, who is 18 years old, and with whom he has an 18-month-old son. They live at his home with his parents and his two brothers.

He has been working as a ranch hand for 10 years, a skill that he learned from doing it with his father. He has been working for a cattle rancher for 8 years. He is in charge of managing 60 cattle with the help of his brother. In his free time, with the help of his family,  he grows corn and vegetables (summer and winter squash) on parcels of land of 3000 square meters.

The loan that he is seeking from Fundación Campo is to buy a motorcycle. This will serve to transport him to his workplace, and he will not have to walk 40 minutes every day early in the morning on dark, graveled roads. He is also planning to go out to sell part of the harvest in neighboring communities.

The needs to satisfy are those of comfort and security and also to provide one more tool with which he can obtain other income by selling some of the products obtained from the harvests.

He states that the most important and most urgent [goal] is to construct a home and live in a different house from his parents.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph lives in Mombasa, Kenya; he is 28 years old, married, and blessed with one child. 

He is happy that he got his first Kiva loan, which he was able to pay back without challenges. 

Joseph is seeking another loan to add more float in to his account (this is stored value credit for sale in mobile money services), so that he can serve more customers. He has been in this business for than three years, and the major problem he faces is the high costs of transport and delays when the system fails. 

The income that is raised from the business will help him improve his living standards.

loans.use: to increase the float in the till.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina lives in Changamwe area in Kenya. She is 35 years old, married, and blessed with three children aged 16, 14, and 5 years old. All of her children attend school. She is a trained tailor and this is what she does for a living. She also sells clothes and handbags in the her tailoring shop. She wants to establish her own boutique and fashion house in the next five years. 

She knew of Milango through friends and now she seeks a loan to purchase clothing materials and suits to sell. The challenge is that some customers do not want to pay their debts. The income she will raise will pay her for children's school fees and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase clothing materials and suits

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer to increase his production

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en: Sofia appreciates her previous loan from Kiva that enabled her to earn profits and improve her living standards. In addition to her charcoal business, she prepares dumplings and sells them to passersby and her neighbors. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 Kenyan shillings to purchase wheat flour, sugar and cooking oil for her dumpling business. She joined Yehu to access the loan funds.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, sugar and cooking oil for her dumpling business.

loans.name: Ines Maria

texts.es: Ines es una mujer que enviudó a temprana edad, pues solo tiene 39 años de edad. Gracias a Dios le quedaron dos hijos, un varón de doce (12) años, y una mujer de dieciocho (18) años de edad. Reside en el municipio de Puerto Colombia, departamento del Atlántico, a 13 km de la Ciudad de Barranquilla, y forma parte del área metropolitana de esta ciudad. Colinda al norte con las costas del mar caribe. Por lo que su actividad económica más importante es el turismo. Su actividad de negocio es la comercialización a crédito de ropa importada de los Estados Unidos de America. Esta actividad la inició hace tres (3) años, cuando una de sus cuñadas, que viaja frecuentemente a los E.U., le propuso vender ropa importada de este país, a lo que ella aceptó, y hasta ahora, gracias a Dios, a tenido mucha acogida. Compra a su cuñada de contado, y le vende a crédito a sus clientes, que en su gran mayoría son amigos y amigas, el resto de clientes son referidos. Su actividad de negocio la ejerce todos los días de ocho (8) de la mañana a siete (7) de la noche. Este es su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, el cual lo aplicará en la compra de blusas, faldas, vestidos, camisas y pantalones importados de los E.U. Con esta inversión espera aumentar la oferta, sus ventas y utilidades. Uno de sus sueños es la de lograr financiar los estudios superiores de sus hijos; y también abrir un almacén.
texts.en:
Ines is only 39 years old and became a widow at an early age. Thanks to God, she still has two children, a 12-year-old son and an 18-year-old daughter. Ines resides in the town of Puerto Colombia in the Department of Atlántico, which is 13 kilometers from the city of Barranquilla and considered to be part of its metropolitan area. The Caribbean Sea is located to the north, so the primary industry in the area is tourism.

Ines has a business of selling imported clothing from the United States, which she offers on credit. She started in this line of work three years when one of her sisters-in-law, who travels frequently to the United States, suggested that she sell imported American clothing. Ines agreed and now, thanks to God, her business has been well-received. She buys the clothes from her sister-in-law with cash and then sells them on credit to her customers, most of whom are her friends. The rest are people who have been referred to her.

Ines operates her business every day from 8:00 A.M. to 7:00 P.M. This is her first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use the money to buy blouses, skirts, dresses, shirts, and trousers imported from the United States. With this investment, she hopes to increase her inventory, her sales, and her profits. One of her dreams is to finance her children’s higher education, but she also wants to open a store.

loans.use: to buy imported clothing from the United States.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce lives in the Ndaragwa area of Kenya, which has one of the cooler climates in Kenya. She has 4 children and has been doing this work for 12 years.  Her primary income sources are milk, crops, and personal business.

She stated that what is most enjoyable about farming is "selling the farm produce." Her biggest challenge is "fetching water for the animals." Animals on the farm have been given the names of "Stolia" and "June."

Joyce was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied "low interest."  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: "The small loans are changing farmers' lives."

Her highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked how this loan will benefit her family Joyce replied that they "will be able to harvest rain water for domestic use."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Joyce owns the following: "cow, poultry" but does not own "pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, or automobile." Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household "solar power, running water" but does not have "mosquito net, electricity, sewing machine, TV, or DVD."

loans.use: to purchase a water tank.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha appreciates the previous loan that she received from Kiva that enabled her to earn more profits to open a clothing-selling business.

She is requesting 10,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to purchase bales of clothes for her business. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for her business.

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en: Having joined Yehu for  financial support, Mwanaisha appreciates the loan she took from Kiva that enabled her to increase her stock and earn more profits, thereby allowing her to open a clothes-selling business. She is now requesting a loan of ksh.10,000 to purchase bales of clothes for her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for her business

loans.name: Cielo Del Socorro

texts.es:
Cielo, a sus 54 años de edad es madre soltera de 3 hijos. Cuando era joven realizó una carrera universitaria y se empleó en una empresa donde trabajó durante 23 años. Alternaba su empleo con uno de sus hobbies favoritos que es hacer manualidades, tejidos y bordados, actividad que aprendió desde que cursaba sus estudios secundarios y que la apasiona desde siempre, tanto, que desde hace 5 años decidió independizarse y montar su propio negocio en el que confecciona todo tipo de prendas tejidas y bordadas, está ubicado en un pequeño espacio de su casa, el cual adecuó como taller y almacén y, adicional a sus prendas, también vende artículos para bebé. 
Cielo es una señora pujante, emprendedora, inteligente y apasionada por lo que hace, pues manifiesta haber cumplido uno de sus principales sueños al poder montar su negocio. Ahora, el reto que se propone es ampliar su negocio, aumentando su clientela e incluso sueña con poder exportar sus prendas a otros países. Esto la motiva para solicitar el crédito, que invertirá en la reparación de su máquina tejedora y necesita comprar un repuesto, con lo que podrá darle continuidad a su negocio, ya que la máquina es la vida del mismo y la fuente de sus ingresos con los que solventa las necesidades y gastos de su familia. Con este apoyo tendrá la posibilidad de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Cielo is 54 years old and a single mother of three children. When she was a young woman, she obtained her university degree and got a job at a company where she worked for 23 years. Cielo divided her time between her job and one of her favorite hobbies, making knitted and embroidered crafts. She learned this skill by taking a high school course and developed a passion that she has always had ever since. Five years ago, Cielo decided to become independent and establish her own business of making all types of knitted and embroidered garments. Her business is located in a small space in her house that doubles as both a workshop and a store. In addition to clothes, she also sells baby products.

Cielo is a successful, enterprising, and intelligent woman who is passionate about what she does. She says that she accomplished one of her important dreams, which was to open her own business. Now her challenge is to expand her business by increasing her clientele and exporting her garments to other countries. For this reason, Cielo is requesting a loan. She will invest in repairs to her knitting machine and the purchase of a necessary spare part so that she can continue her business. Cielo and her business are dependent on that machine since she must have a source of income to cover necessities and family expenses. With this support, she will be able to improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to repair her knitting machine and to purchase a necessary spare part.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a post-graduate course.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is married with six children and all her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (cousins).  

She has a business of selling used shoes and has been in this business for three years. She has work seven days out of every week and sells on a retail basis only. 

She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used shoes. Her major business challenges include thieves and seasonality. She is aspiring of importing used shoes and also to become a wholesaler. She resides in the family house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent for her business premises and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used shoes.

loans.name: Las Guerreras De Ventanilla Alta Group

texts.es:
Las Guerreras De Ventanilla Alta es un grupo compuesto por  06 socias, Bertha es una de sus integrantes, ella tiene 40 años  es casada y tiene 02 hijos; en la actualidad  vive en casa de  sus padres. Bertha se dedica a la venta de lencería y ropa intima  para mujer; en la actualidad no cuenta con un lugar estable para atender a su clientela por ahora solo trabaja por pedidos y entregas a domicilio, sus clientas son amigas, familiares y personas recomendadas. Bertha ha solicitado este préstamo para comprar lenceria y medias, sobretodo nuevos modelos que sus clientas le han solicitado, gracias a sus ventas su negocio seguirá prosperando y así podrá ayudar a su esposo para poder solventar los estudios de sus hijos, mas adelante le gustaría encontrar un lugar donde establecer su negocio y poder llegar a mas compradores.
Bertha está entusiasmada con la ayuda de los inversionistas y quiere agradecer a nombre de ella y todo su grupo comunal, en la foto es la tercera de la izquierda viste casaca color negra.
texts.en:
The Guerreras De Ventanilla Alta group is composed of six members. Bertha is one member. She is 40 years old, married and has two children. She lives in the house of her parents. Bertha sells woman's lingerie. Right now she has no fixed place to sell to her clientele, she works on orders and deliveries. Her clients are friends, acquaintances and people recommended to her. 

Bertha is requesting this loan to buy lingerie and stockings, especially new designs that her customers have requested. Thanks to her sales, her business has continued to prosper. She can help her husband pay for their children's studies. She would also like to find a place where she could establish her business, thereby reaching more buyers. Bertha is excited about the assistance from the lenders and would like to thank them in her name and for all the members of the communal bank. She is the third from the left in the photo, wearing the black jacket.

loans.use: to buy lingerie.

loans.name: Nuestra Señora De La Asuncion Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Nuestra Señora de la Asuncion está en su 3° ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, una de ellas es la Sra. Cesaria, quien se dedica a la venta de prendas variadas, ella se define a sí misma como una persona que quiere mejorar su vida por medio del trabajo.
Dice también que su grupo está con mucho entusiasmo, donde todas y cada una de ellas esta capacitándose para poder mejorar. Cesaria hoy solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas de invierno, ya que estamos en la época de frío y quiere tener una buena variedad de prendas que ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The “Nuestra Señora de la Asuncion” [Our Lady of the Assumption] group is in its third cycle of the women’s committee program. Cesaria is one of the members of the group, and she works selling various articles of clothing. She describes herself as someone who wants to improve her life through working.

Cesaria says that the group has a lot of enthusiasm, and that all of the members are learning how to improve their lives. Cesaria is requesting this loan to buy winter clothing, as it is now the cold season and she wants to have a good selection of clothing to offer her customers.

loans.use: to buy winter clothing to offer for sale.

loans.name: Ofelia Ines

texts.es:
En la localidad conocida con el nombre de Pachinche de la parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora y dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Banco Comunal Damas Emprendedoras De Pachinche.

En este lugar vive la señora Ofelia, tiene 24 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 7 y 5 años que  estudian en escuela. Su esposo es taxista.

Doña Ofelia es una joven madre y esposa que para obtener sus propios recursos y ayudar con estos al bienestar de sus hijos se dedica a  la cría de pollos en una pequeña granja en la cual por temporadas mete de 50 a 100 pollos dependiendo de la demanda que exista en esos momentos, esto es algo que no le quita mayor tiempo y le permite además de ganarse algo estar al tanto de sus hijos.

Este crédito es para comprar alimentos y medicinas para los pollos para que estos tengan un buen crecimiento. Está en el banco comunal hace 2 ciclos y le gusta ya que  los créditos le ayudan para salir adelante. 

Su sueño es tener una granja más grande.
texts.en:
In a community called Pachinche, which belongs to the parish of Colon in the city of Portoviejo, a place known for its hardworking people who work in agriculture and livestock, the members of the "Damas Emprendedoras de Pachinche" ("Women Entrepreneurs of Pachinche") communal bank meet every fifteen days.

Ofelia lives in this community. She is 24 years old and married. She has two children from her marriage, ages 5 and 7, who are studying at school. Her husband is a taxi driver.

Ofelia is a young mother and wife who raises chickens on a small farm to earn her own income and help out with her children's well-being. She puts between 50 and 100 chickens on her farm every season, depending on the demand that exists at the time. This is something that does not take up much of her time and also allows her to earn something and keep track of her children.

She will use this loan to buy feed and medicine for her chickens to ensure their healthy growth. She has been part of the communal bank for two cycles, and she enjoys it because the loans help her to move ahead.

Her dream is to have a larger farm.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicine for her chickens.

loans.name: Maribel Del Rocio

texts.es:
En la localidad conocida con el nombre de Pachinche de la parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora y dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Banco Comunal Damas Emprendedoras De Pachinche.

En este lugar vive la señora Maribel, tiene 39 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 19, 14 y 8 años de edad, los menores estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.

Doña Maribel es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de zapatillas y productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Ella también se dedica a realizar trabajos de bordados, estos trabajos los hace a base de pedidos para una señora le hace, lleva 5 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien ya que este es un trabajo que lo hace en los momentos que está desocupada y en cualquier parte, al igual que sus ventas ya que son por catálogos.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, bisutería, telas e hilos para los bordados. Está en el banco comunal desde hace más de 4 años  y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. 

Sus sueños son que sus hijos sean profesionales y tener buena salud.
texts.en:
In a community called Pachinche, which belongs to the parish of Colon in the city of Portoviejo, a place known for its hardworking people who work in agriculture and livestock, the members of the "Damas Emprendedoras de Pachinche" ("Women Entrepreneurs of Pachinche") communal bank meet every fifteen days.

Maribel, 39, lives in this community. She is married with three children, ages 8, 14, and 19. The younger children are studying at school. Her husband works in agriculture.

Maribel is a housewife who sells slippers and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and women's accessories) to earn her own money. She also does embroidery work for a woman who gives her orders. She has had this business for 5 years. It is going very well because she can do this job in her free time from anywhere, just like her sales, which she does by catalog order.

She will use this loan to buy perfume, creams, jewelry, fabric, and thread for her embroidery. She has been with the communal bank for more than four years, and she enjoys it because of the help the loans give her.

Her dreams are for her children to become professionals and to have good health.

loans.use: to buy perfume, creams, jewelry, fabric, and thread.

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
Karine and her family lives in the village Avshar which is in the Ararat region. Karine is married and has two daughters and a son. Her elder daughter and son are married and live separately with their families. 

Karine’s youngest daughter, who is 21 years old, unfortunately suffers a severe disease since her childhood. Karine says that during these years her daughter has passed numerous medical examinations, courses of treatments and she has been also been operated on several times, but there are no positive changes, no matter the different medicines and their belief, hope and strong  desire for any little change from this condition. It is very hard for Karine and her husband to see their daughter like this: helpless and sad. She can do nothing without their help, since she is in a wheelchair. The symptoms of her disease recur periodically and each time they need more money to try some new, more effective medicine for any change from this hard condition.
 
So Karine has asked for a loan of 1,000,000 Armenian Drams to be able to pay for her daughter’s medicine and medical examinations that they are passing regularly.

loans.use: pay for her daughter’s medicine and medical examinations

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma appreciates the previous loan from Kiva.  The profits from which she used to open another business.  

Fatuma operates a Khanga  (women wrap cloth) business. She is requesting  KSH10,000 to purchase bales of Khangas for her business.  She joined Yehu for financial support.

loans.use: buy Khangas to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy earrings, necklaces and mirrors

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy handbags, clothes and shoes
